review.title: Great location - Wonderful customer service
review.reviewText: I took my 75 year old Mom to San Francisco for her first time. The hotel was located right on a cable car route which was very convenient. Since my Mom found cable car rides to be her very favorite thing in San Francisco, the proximity to the cable car turnaround was great. When we checked into the hotel I requested a higher floor on the quietest side since my Mom has a hard time sleeping. Diana at the front desk spent some time finding us a different room which turned out to be an upgrade. She did not charge us an upgrade fee which was wonderful. Our room was very quiet and we were most appreciative. The beds were very comfortable. I enjoyed being able to grab a glass of wine in the lounge downstairs and take it to our room. If in San Francisco again, I would definitely consider staying at this Marriott.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Customer Service and Comfortable Bed
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom floor could have been cleaner and tub drained slow. We ended up standing in water when we showered. Maintenance fixed timely when we called.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near cable car turnaround.

review.title: Overpriced, Lousy Housekeeping Service
review.reviewText: First of all the Hotel will charge you an extra $100 per day that you stay at the hotel. They deducted $500 extra when I got there in case I used room service. Imagine that. Must be illegal, but they do it. Then I checked my bank account a few days later and the Marriott had also charged an extra $300 on my debit card, for a total of $800 in extra charges for nothing. I went to the front desk and the lady working at the front desk told me I need to use a credit card rather than a debit card because otherwise the hotel just keeps making fake charges, they just do is - I guess cause they can. You get your money back when you check out but they had $800 of my money tied up for 5 days for nothing, in case I used room service. Next, they didn't change the sheets for 3 days. Housekeeping shows up at 3 p.m. and they just press the wrinkles out of the sheets and leave same sheets on the bed. They finally changed the sheets after three days, another maid came in early and changed the sheets. They are so cheap, they give you 2 tiny pieces of paper and a pen. That's it. No writing pad, no replacement pad when they do housekeeping. They did not vacuum the room either. They are so cheap they don't like to replace the empty box of face tissue. It's a good location, very high price, bad housekeeping, bad service all the way around, and they run up big charges on your debit card for no reason.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping. For $250 per night clean the room, vacuum it, change the sheets. Don't ask customers to tip housekeeping.
review.locationRemarks: It's right near Union Square.

review.title: Clean, safe hotel centrally located.
review.reviewText: Near Union Square, lots of great shopping in walking distance.  Cable car tracks run right next to hotel.  Short cab fare to Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz Island Tour, Japan town, etc.  Hotel very clean, staff friendly, easy checkout.  .
review.positiveRemarks: My wife felt very safe and secure and we would definitely stay here again when we return to the City.

review.title: Spectacular Hotel , convenient
review.reviewText: My family and I arrived at Marriott Hotel, front Desk Staff was amazing, I was given a room with acceptable view but not the best. I called front desk and asked if they could place us in a room with a view. We were transferred to a room with the most Astonishing view of San Francisco. A dream come true. Loved it!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing to improve
review.locationRemarks: Trolley Stop, shopping restaurants, china town

review.title: Fabulous location.
review.reviewText:
Clean and comfortable helpful staff.
Close to trolley, restaurants and Union Sq.
I liked the hotel location and condition overall but I think The rate per night was a bit overpriced
Price is reasonable considering union square of San Francisco, location is very good , room is small and facility is average

This Marriott at Union Square is an excellent hotel in a prime location with many local dining spots along with several Starbucks close by.  Located on the Powell street cable car route a short walk from Union Square and the cable-car turn around all of which are very convenient!  The Westfield Village Mall at Union Square is very good and it has the best Food Court we have experienced in a mall to date!  Everything the hotel committed to us was as promised and much appreciated!ðŸ˜Š
As had been to SF about 7month, it's hard to find this kind of nice place where is good location and reasonable price

review.title: Terrific hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great staff attention from the moment we arrived until the moment we departed.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, shopping, cable car, great dining.

review.reviewText:
Very happy with our stay. 

The front desk was very helpful.

review.title: Great Hotel and very central to other location
review.reviewText: I like the location of the hotel. The staff is so helpful with giving you the requested information.But still expensive rate per night.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and quality service and  clean,
review.negativeRemarks: price more reasonable
review.locationRemarks: very good location is walking distance to the greatest places

review.title: Good hotel with downside
review.reviewText: We liked the room and location very much, but we're disappointed that we had to pay extra to access wifi in the room and that some members of staff reacted in an unfriendly manner if they did not get the size of tip they expected.

review.title: Great location, clean, well kept
review.reviewText: Room was clean, well designed, good working desk with lots of outlets, good lighting.  Liked the sofa chair with ottoman.  Was able to check in early and get some rest from overnight flight.  Hotel a block from Union Square, lots place to eat, there is a Walgreens across the street.  Cable car runs past the hotel.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Great food and refreshments at the 28th floor elite lounge.  Great view of San Francisco Bay, Macy's, and Union Square
review.positiveRemarks: I really liked the elite lounge that overlooks Union Square and Macy's from the 28th floor.  Lounge attendant friendly and very helpful, great food.
review.negativeRemarks: The card entry to room was a little tricky, I had a little difficulty in getting the green light.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is around the corner, cable cars runs past hotel, Walgreen and Lori's across the street.  Lots of place to eat and shop.

review.title: Nice location right by a 24 hour Walgreens
review.reviewText: Stay was great, location was great, wish the hotels here were not so pricey but you are paying for location

review.title: Marriott Union Square - Amazing
review.reviewText: Marriott Union Square has set the bar extremely high when it comes to service. From the call to confirm my reservation to the professional, outgoing service extended by the Front Desk, Bar Staff, Concierge and Doormen/Valets. I've stayed at many Marriott's, this property is a diamond in the Marriott chain. Business or  time-off, I would highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Little if any room for improvement
review.locationRemarks: Nice location if working downtown and all forms of transit are right there - even the Cable Cars

review.title: In the heart of everything! Loved it!
review.reviewText: Perfect location, excellent hotel and wonderful staff!

review.title: What an amazing hotel!
review.reviewText: The service is excellent, staff is very friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. My room had a view of the city and it was a great one. The quality of food is excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: So we arrived a little early but decided to see if we could check in anyway.  I asked the front desk woman if we could check in considering the time and she sarcastically responded with "that's what I'm doing, checking you in." I didn't quite like the attitude but the rest of my stay was great so I quickly forgot about that bad first impression. The hotel was very clean, quiet and centrally located within walking distance of Chinatown and Union Square. There room didn't have a microwave or a refrigerator but those things were minor. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again.

review.title: Comfy bed and amazing view
review.reviewText: We stayed one night at the tail end of a week long bicycle trip.  The hotel itself has a very commanding presence from the outside and is located near tons of great shops and restaurants.  The staff was very friendly and courteous.  The room, while on the smaller side, were very clean and comfortable.  We were on the 16th floor and had a great view of the bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and comfortable, easy to walk to and from, lots of great dining options nearby
review.locationRemarks: We enjoyed a fantastic sushi dinner just around the corner and up half a block, and breakfast at Lori's Diner was amazing!

review.title: Good location near attractions and transportation.
review.reviewText: Excellent staff very helpful. The concierge promptly helped arrange various activities. This was very important since I booked a tour on Expedia that did not exist. I received the the bad news in route, so Betty saved the day.

Checkin was great. Staff very accommodating. Room was nice & quiet. Unlike most Marriotts this one had a great tv channel selection. Did room service one night & enjoyed my selection very much. It was a great location to meet all of my tours.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, in the middle of town. Walking distance to Chinatown, bus station and BART station too. Next time will stay there.

review.title: I can hear noise from other room.
review.reviewText: The Hotel was nice except for the noise. I would go back again though. And would recommend it to my friends.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText:
Adequate. We asked the concierge to recommend a five star restaurant to celebrate our birthdays. It was a treat for my college student grandson. We asked for a place where we could dress up and have a good meal. She booked the Chart House, a two star restaurant at Pier 39. Did she not understand?

However, Kelley canceled the booking and recommended Michael Mina; a fine restaurant for food and service. We celebrated there and was very pleased. The restaurant was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge recommendations should respond more positively to requests and front desk training.
review.locationRemarks: There was plenty to do. We really enjoyed San Francisco..

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel right in the heart of Union Square

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to everything. Easy access to shopping, foods and tourist destinations.  The room is big, clean and with nice decor. The room was so comfortable after a long day exploring busy San Francisco.  The staffs could be a little be more friendlier and more helpful. Other than that I would come back and stay at the same hotel again when visiting SF.
Reliable Marriott experience in a fantastic location in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel & convenient to needs.
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed and pillows. Very nice place to stay.

review.title: Stay
review.reviewText:
One of our belonging got stolen in the hotel lobby when we checked in.
The hotel front desk staff were inpatient and not helpful throughout our stay.

review.title: All hotel staff was friendlyâ€¦good service
review.reviewText: Lovely room with great view for the price.  Maid was especially helpful and her service was superb!
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants near by..Sears Restaurant is a great old time S.F. family style restaurant..very good American Cuisine..

review.title: Great Hotel close to public transportation
review.reviewText: It was very easy to move around.  Powell and Hyde Station in the corner and Union Square only a few steps away from the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great place to get to the shopping area and to take the 3 lines of cable cars in SF.

review.title: Superb hotel very attentive and friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Smiling front desk receptionist found us a perfect room upon arrival with King size bed and killer view on 21st floor, view of cable car tracks and San Fransisco Bay.  Clean cozy perfect room with ample space lots of light and very nice matching furniture, upholstery, matching paint schemes, a true retreat with good electric lighting reading lights, nighst and lights, floor lamp and desk lamp. Beautiful furniture real veneers quality finishes and hardware. Outgoing staff at all stations, very accomodating,  going the extra mile, giving advice, making reservations, handing out maps with directions giving verbal ques to distance and directions. Front desk, concierge, door person. breakfast waitstaff, bar personal all extremely friendly, helpful smiling. Just a great place
review.negativeRemarks: Wonder if I left my shoe stretchers in the room?
review.locationRemarks: Center of town, near stores, restaurants, cable cars, theaters, cable cars, trolleys, busses, museums, stores, people.

review.reviewText: Exellent reception and services. They are very friendly and professinal. The room is very clean and very convenient to get around Union Square.

review.title: Expensive and no good...
review.reviewText:
For that price it was a terrible hotel, no minibar or a fridge, no breakfast or wi-fi included in price.
Never staying at the Marriott again!
The hotel has a nice location, and the rooms are comfortable. It did not have a fancy hotel feel, and the rooms are no different from an average hotel. A pool would have been nice for the kids.

review.title: In the City of Love
review.reviewText: Great location close to all and major public transportation.

review.title: Great for location to Trolley and Union Square
review.reviewText: Need a spa area with pool and/hot tub.  Need mini-fridge in room
review.negativeRemarks: Need to put the mini fridges back in rooms.  You could tell they used to have them, then removed them

review.title: Great place to stay if you're in town for business
review.reviewText: I was here just for one night but it was a very pleasant experience. Everything you expect from a great hotel was there and the staff was outstanding.  Every single staff person I dealt with were very friendly and true professionals.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was a little hard.  I woke up a couple of times trying to get comfortable but then again,  there is nothing as comfortable as your own bed.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, lots of choices to eat outside of the hotel.

review.reviewText: Noisy near Union Sq. but windows are soundproofed which helps a lot. Stayed in a club room (29th floor) with lounge access. Contrary to what other reviewers stated, the breakfast in the lounge is excellent (full English, etc) - in fact, everything served in the lounge was superb. Also, the room service in this hotel is perhaps the highest quality food I ever had in a hotel (this says a lot since I frequently stay in hotels and eat room service food). Overall, a great hotel for business travelers wishing to stay next to Union Sq.

review.title: Great hotel in an awesome location
review.reviewText: The room was very clean, and all the staff were very polite and helpful. The bed was amazingly comfortable! Overall a great place to stay close to Union Square, and close to public transportation to get around the city.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff were excellent
Service was attentive and informed

review.title: Not very impressive
review.reviewText: Not very impressive. Front desk is not very friendly.

review.title: Easy to park at the garage down the street.
review.reviewText: Locate well for walking to China town or Union Square.
Great service from the staff, especially the doorman! Great personality and always smiling.

review.title: Terrible beds and super small bathrooms.
review.reviewText: I will not stay at this hotel again. The bed was really uncomfortable and the bathroom was extremely small with no space to put the toileteries. The staff was also not friendly. You could find so many better hotels in Union Square for the same amount.

review.title: Close to all the events we wanted to visit!
review.reviewText: What friendly and helpful staff.  Excellent location!!
review.positiveRemarks: Close to all of our activities, clean hotel and friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Close to the pier; very short walk to shoppes, convenience and pharmacy stores are very close

review.title: Best location; Great rooms.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff allowed early check in on Black Friday.  Rooms able to be switched around to accommodate our party.  They were willing to revise my rooms, compared to my expedia booking, which most hotels have NOT done in the past: once you book w expedia, you're stuck w/ whatever you booked. Marriott allowed me to upgrade rooms, but keep same expedia price.

review.title: Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great staff at all points of contact, from reception to restaurant staff.

review.title: Nice hotel downtown San fran
review.reviewText: Had a great stay. Beds were super comfy. Staff were friendly. Room service was alright. Bar downstairs was really good. Recommend the hummus and chips

Booked this place for a weekend getaway for me and my wife. Everything was amazing. Within walking distance of everything.  Staff was awesome. Room was impeccable, with a great view. Will definitely be staying here when we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and modern. The staff was very friendly, and always willing to help.
review.positiveRemarks: It is clean, modern and the staff was very welcoming.

review.title: Perfect and safe location right next to cable car.
review.reviewText: Doormen were wonderful, staff were extremely courteous, and food at hotel was great.  Perfect choice hotel!!  15th floor room.

review.title: Great!!
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel.  Great location.  Room is clean and beds are very comfortable.  Hotel staff was not real friendly but was accomodating. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Mini Vacation
review.reviewText: My adult son and I spent a long weekend in San Francisco. Neither of us had ever been to the city before. We reviewed many hotels when booking and settled on this one based on it's many excellent reviews. We were not disappointed! The hotel was beautiful, the staff were over the top accomodating and the amenities were top notch. This location in Union Square is within walking distance (safely) to so many must see and must do's. I would recommend staying here!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is close to China Town, Ghiradeli Square, Fisherman's Wharf etc.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Second stay at this location. Great staff, rooms were clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel near union square!  Prices are steep like all of the bug chain hotels in the area, but it really is a fantastic place to stay if you are doing Nike Women's half marathon, as the start line is only a block away.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The Marriott Union Square is a perfect location. It's within walking distance to great bars and restaurants. The room was super nice.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Overall it was good. I think the bathroom sink area was too small. But the room seemed clean and was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom placement of towels and size of sink area.
review.locationRemarks: Everything

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The Expedia base room price was more expensive than the hotel direct price. Friends in the next room paid $80 less for the exact same room. The hotel stated that we were tied to the Expedia price. Very disappointing.
Nice hotel with very helpful staff! Great location. Did not like having to pay for Internet but everything else good!

review.title: center of Union square
review.reviewText: Very nice location in central union square. Comfortable bed, clean room and good amenities.
Hotel had great location, cleaning staff was tremendous and flexible, front desk staff comp'ed me things I was supposed to be charged for (like laundry detergent).

review.title: The Manager, Susan, is simply outstanding.
review.reviewText:
Arrived mid-morning before the rooms were ready. It was busy and the Manager was up front helping the Front Desk Check in and out. This is a Manager that cares about Customer Service. She (Susan, I wish I had her last name) assisted me. I requested a room off the street so it wold not be noisy. She reviewed her computer and told me she had a great room available, but has not been cleaned yet, but to check my luggage in and enjoy Union Square. We did so and a couple of hours later we were in a great room well off street level with a view. It was obvious in her efficient work, effort, smile, friendliness - she was a really good host - that customer service was important to her. I think she set the example as all of the staff I interacted with were very helpful, and helped you with a smile in a very busy environment.

I consider this Hotel to be in a great location with staff that represents Marriott very well. I do recommend. I am not a paid or privileged reviewer - just very impressed from my personal experience.
review.positiveRemarks: This Hotel is one block from the main Union Square. Restrurants in sight of walking out the front door. I've read that the area is seedy. I disagree.
review.negativeRemarks: I think they do a great job as it is.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of restrurant choices, Union Square just a short block away, China Town a very short walk. This is a great central location.

review.title: Great hotel near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great staff, clean and comfortable rooms. Down town San Fran so very central to everything.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Very centrally located with a tram stop right outside the hotel.  Rooms very clean and beds extremely comfortable.  Will be staying there again when I return to San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: Central, close to trams, easy walk to Union Square, clean rooms.

review.title: Excellent 5 star experience!
review.reviewText: Came to San Francisco for the first time and decided to stay at this hotel in union square and it was a great choice we made. The staff was very helpful and ever time we entered the hotel after returning from our adventures we were greeted each time with thoughtful words and smiles. I also recommend the hotel/bar 48, super cool staff and food! Room was super clean and comfy! We felt like we were right at home!

review.title: Hotel close to Union Square and the cable cars
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is nice and the staff great. My room was run down. Two primary issues were carpet pulling up and the bath tub had been painted over with the paint peeling up in sections. The A/C was just plain annoying as it cycled on and off every few minutes and very loudly. The worst part, though, was the bed. It was so far beyond soft that I was in constant back pain while unsuccessfully attempting to sleep in it. Of all the hotels I have stayed at in the past 50 years that was by far the most uncomfortable bed.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and location were wonderful
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel the run down rooms and get better beds
review.locationRemarks: The cable cars run by right next to the hotel. Lots of shopping and dining options are in walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good location to travel around the city. Close to Union Square, department stores, china town etc.  Nice and clean room. We really enjoyed the staying.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good room, ideal to get around. Nothing fancy but everything was comfortable.
Great hotel, great location though I thought I was going to be at the one that is closer to Moscone center this one was close to Union square, China town etc.

review.title: safe haven amidst urban jungle
review.reviewText:
Stayed here while dropping our daughter off at college. The location is in a busy urban area close to many restaurants and competing hotels. Upon first glance I had thought that we might have made a mistake by booking here due to the congestion on the streets, but I could not have been more delighted by our three night stay. From the moment we pulled up to the valet, we encountered the friendliest, most helpful staff. The valet, the security guard, the bellhop and the receptionist all went out of their way to help us get situated. It was a pleasure chatting with these gentlemen each day as we ventured back and forth from hotel to our daily adventures.
Room was clean and fresh upon arrival and the beds were just right for a good night's sleep...awesome pillows!
Room service was fast! Even when calling for a pot of coffee during the morning rush, we received it almost immediately. And the late night meal was hot and hearty.
The valet had our car ready right on time each day and gave us helpful tips for safety.
The bellhops always dutifully handled our many bags and helped us shuffle the hoard of college supplies around the vehicle like puzzle pieces.
Our room on the 19th floor was a safe haven from the chaos which can permeate the SF streets. Oh, and the elevators were smooth and fast!
I cannot think of one problem-- It was a terrific stay!
review.positiveRemarks: central location, cleanliness of room, friendliness & helpfulness of staff
review.locationRemarks: many restaurants, coffee shops, trolley cars, union square with lots of shops and many people.

review.title: Good hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
Location great but you pay for that. Plenty of places to eat around. Room was ok, 8th floor overlooking/ed hotel opposite. 
We were so busy by day that it was a place to crash by night and it was comfortable.

review.title: An Okay Choice for Great Location
review.reviewText:
Perfect location just off of Union Sq.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Rooms were eeehhh.  Not terrible, but nothing really good.  Pretty small with TINY bathroom.  TV is tiny as well with choppy reception on multiple channels.  The lobby was nice and comfortable with a nice little lobby bar.  

If your are just looking for location and a more reasonable price than some of the other hotels in Union Sq., not bad at all, especially if you don't plan on spending much time in the room other than a pit stop and to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms a bit.  Bigger TVs with better reception.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location.  Right next to Union Sq. and the cable cars.  Very central.

review.title: Not bad but not great
review.reviewText: For a Marriott we were disappointed.  The bathroom was so small, no shelf space either.  And the bed was lumpy on one side.  Time for a new mattress I believe.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Great stay and loved the location!  Forgot my contacts for this trip and I have a close friend who organized contacts for me (as a surprise) while in transit to San Francisco.  They called into the hotel and were assisted by a manager - I'm not sure of the exact details but I do know she went above her normal job description to help arrange contacts for me... It was appreciated and very helpful biking over the Golden Gate bridge!  I found all the staff at the hotel to be very warm & welcoming.  Would recommend this hotel to friends & colleagues..
review.negativeRemarks: N/A

review.title: Hotel staff was extremely helpful
review.reviewText: I was in town for business and the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The room was quite clean and the bed was comfortable.

review.title: Expensive, but convenient.
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel. The beds are super comfortable and room was cleaned well. It's right in the heart of Union Square, close to all the shopping you'd need. Bars, food are all close by. There's a blues bar (Biscuits and Blues) that play live music and is nice to walk to and catch a show. Parking is RIDICULOUS at $60/night. I had to pay it because I needed my car on this trip. The hotel is right near the cable car pickup that takes you to Fishermans Wharf. You could honestly walk to the wharf faster, though! Nice hotel, convenient, cozy, nice views after the 14th floor - otherwise you'll get stuck looking at brick buildings. If a view is your thing, make sure you take a view that faces Coit or the bay.

review.title: Almost on Union Square, well located
review.reviewText: We were in SF for 5 days as tourists, had a great time.  The concierge was great, the desk was very helpful, and the maid service was great.
review.positiveRemarks: We also enjoyed breakfast in the hotel, even though there were many other options in the area.
review.locationRemarks: Just being near Union Squre for tourists is enough.  Near the cable car line.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the trolley and stores.
review.reviewText: Great hotel.  We were on the 19th floor and it is very quiet. Nice staff and close to a lot of attractions.

review.title: GOOD HOTEL RIGHT IN THE HEART OF THINGS
review.reviewText: Stayed for 6 days and it was a good location for most things.  Plenty of shopping and short walk to Chinatown. Good public transportation and a concierge who could always tell you how to get places. Union Square is the perfect location.  Service was a little slow in the hotel restaurant, but improved quickly.  Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: A great hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Union Square is a great area for things to do (plays, comedy clubs, live music), excellent restaurants and riding the cable car, of course. This Marriott really shined. All staff: car valet, doormen, front desk, and housekeeping were very welcoming and great at what they do...loving their guests! I had to make a trip to the Hospital ER, unfortunately, one night. The doorman got me & my wife a taxi and asked me what room I was in. Later that night there was a personal note from the Hotel Manager saying they were sorry I was not feeling well and asked if there was anything else they could do to make me comfortable. What a great touch! I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, very clean, great service.
review.locationRemarks:
Biscuits & Blues is a great place, just 2 blocks away. Great live blues and jazz & excellent food & drinks.
We saw Lavay Smith, excellent band!!

review.title: Room was larger than expected.
review.reviewText: Room size enabled us to walk around without getting in each otherÊ»s way or bumping into furniture.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Chinatown and San Francisco Centre and the Bart station.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Cross street (Powell) made it easy for others in our party to locate the Bart, etc.

review.title: Visit to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very close to Union Square and to the Trolley station.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds.  No rest if you are tired.  Beds are too soft for me.
review.locationRemarks: Can go easily in the North and East directions.  Walking around is suggested.

review.title: Great location, awesome staff
review.reviewText: Was here for a conference and loved it! Clean, quiet, comfortable, with a very friendly and helpful staff. Concierges found me great things to do and places to eat. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Great hotel in Union square
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying at the Marriott in Union square. Great location in the heart of San Francisco. Service and staff were welcoming.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful and the hotel oozed class. We enjoyed our stay.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel is across the street from a cable car stop.  A Starbucks across the street.  Location couldn't be better.  The room was clean which is all I ask. The staff polite. Our stay was perfect
review.negativeRemarks: nothing  but the price but all in this area are expensive

review.reviewText: Not that it was a big deal but, I was never asked what room configuration or what floor I might prefer. I found a machine for drying carpets in the room but let it pass. I had a meal at the hotel restaurant and had to repeat the order to the waitress a few times because she didn't write the order down and kept forgetting.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel was clean but decor could use an upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby restaurants, bars and shopping.

review.title: Good hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a good location, very central to all of union squares facilities, including tram stops & BART station. Room was very comfortable & clean. Staff always very helpful. Restaurant was ok. Parking available although a little expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Very central to Union Square

review.title: Great hotel

review.title: Poor service for "4*" hotel.
review.reviewText: A $250+ a night hotel should all be about having to think about as little as possible. Having to call every day to get water to fill all the tumblers left in the room got tiring very quickly. There should be a minibar or complimentary water left in the room. You couldn't make coffee if you wanted to. Could also provide some complimentary cookies like elsewhere. Service was generally more of a self service budget hotel, and boarding pass computers were broken. Bathroom was small but room was an okay size. Bed was comfortable and lobby was large for the location. The hotel was adequate but not memorable for any notable touches you get elsewhere.

review.title: Great location and value!
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I stayed here on a Saturday night and would definitely book again. I always book at Marriott for the beds alone, and this one did not disappoint! Very comfortable bed and linens. Great location near Union Square, within walking distance to so many things. The staff was great and very polite. We had a king room and the size was great for being in the city. 
Valet was quick and they allowed us to keep our car there past the noon check-out so we could explore the city for the afternoon without being charged.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds and linens are always top notch with Marriott
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants and shopping nearby.

review.title: One Block from Union Square
review.reviewText: Check in and check out was a breeze.  We did not expect a corner suite and were very happy with our room.  We could see what I think was the bay or a portion of the bay from our room on the 26th floor as well as Union Square.  The room was large, comfortable, 2 queen beds, 2 nice comfortable chairs, 1 sofa, a desk, and plenty of light.  The bathroom was plenty large with a tub/shower combination.  We were both under the weather and had to visit the doctor that the hotel provided which was only a block away which was convenient as well as the Walgreens that was just across the street.  We did not get to do anything except recover from our China tour so it was really nice to have such a clean, comfortable room with helpful staff.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable beds, pleasant and helpful staff, close to shopping (Macy's, Neiman's, etc.) and 1 block from Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: More attention could be paid to killing and removing all the black mold around the bathtub and the sink.  There wasn't much but some.

Room and bathroom was very clean.  Concierge was helpful.  Close to shopping and restaurants

review.title: San Francisco Girl's Weekend
review.reviewText:
From the time we arrived until we left, we were very pleased with the hotel experience.  The hotel was chosen as one of the members in our party had stayed there previously.  The hotel was in a perfect location as it was close to trolley and bus lines for easy transportation to areas of interest.  In addition, it was close to Chinatown and North Beach - two areas we were interested in experiencing.  The concierge(s) provided excellent information and were very helpful in providing directions, recommendations for restaurants, etc.    

Each afternoon, upon returning to the hotel, our beds were made, the bathrooms were cleaned and fresh towels were available as needed.  The door and bellmen were very helpful with our luggage when needed.  

We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.locationRemarks: Marriott in Union Square - shopping, Chinatown, North Beach, good restaurants

review.title: Good location and fair value
review.reviewText: This hotel is located near Union Square and is within walking distance of most of the areas we wanted to see.  It is several blocks from the Muni terminal which takes you to many parts of SF.  Parking in SF is outrageous which we were aware of, $50+ per night.  They charge for internet access-boo.  No refrig in the room which was unfortunate.  Room was clean.  Stayed in a corner Jr. Suite.  Was adequate size.  Bar drinks were expensive, for 2 drinks it was consistently over $20.  No newspapers available on-site either complementary or for purchase.  All in all an average SF hotel.  Although the room rate through Expedia was good for a jr. suite($239), with parking and internet it wasn't a bargain by any means.

review.title: Superb experience
review.reviewText: An absolutely fantastic stay in the heart of downtown San Francisco - we couldn't recommend the Marriott highly enough. The location was convenient for everything, the room was clean, comfortable and spacious, but most of all, the staff were fantastic. Everyone from the doormen to the porters were characterful, well mannered and went the extra mile. Also, the restaurant and bar was a great experience, with the manager touring the floor ensuring all was in order, and the waiting staff being ever attentive. Also, excellent martinis and craft beer selection. Would always recommend.

review.title: Nice hotel. Very good location.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is nice, especially its location. It is so close to Union Square and all types of transportation to get to any place that you choose to go. We visited the Wharf on several different days. We took the ferry over to Alcatraz and Sausalito. We rode the trolley all over town. We also did a day tour on the "Get On and Off" bus. The hotel makes sure that taxi service is readily available. We used the taxi to get from and to the airport. Rooms in this hotel are small, but very clean. We expected this because of its ideal location.The entire hotel staff was very helpful and friendly, especially the concierge. I had the best onion soup in the restaurant there that I have ever had. My only complaint was the toilet tissue holder in our room. It is poorly designed and kept falling off the wall.  I left it in the floor two days thinking that housekeeping would notice that it was not staying on. Once it fell on my toe. Ouch. It didn't hurt enough though for me to take the time to report it, which I should have done.
Other than that, our stay was wonderful and I would stay at this hotel again. Great memories from this trip.

review.title: Great downtown location
review.reviewText: The SF Marriott at Union Square is very nice, clean and has a friendly staff.  But the best thing about the hotel is it's location.  On the corner of Sutter and Powell, it's right by all the great shops and restaurants of Union Square.  In addition, there is a Cable Car stop (not to mention a Starbucks!) right across the street.  It's an easy walk to either the Financial District or the Powell Street BART station.  Another plus is even with being located right on Powell, it's very quiet.  I've stayed at several of the hotels in that area and the others all seemed noisy in comparison.
review.positiveRemarks: Definitely the location is the best thing about the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant is only open in the morning.  It would be nice to have another food option other than room service.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all the shops and sites of Union Square, easy walk to Financial District or BART station, on the Powell St. Cable Car line.

review.title: Pot Smoking Hippies
review.reviewText:
Great location and centrally located a few blocks from the main cable car. Recommend purchasing an all day MUNI pass to get around the city. Much cheaper than taking cabs.
My one gripe was the security guard that knocked on our door inquiring about smoke coming from our floor. My sister was in a towel, so I told him to hold on while she got dressed. He stuck his big foot in the door and wouldn't allow me to close it. When we let him in, he sniffed every corner and informed us someone was smoking on our floor. We were a little surprised and caught off guard considering none of us smoke. We had a good laugh but none the less were taken back by his persistence. Bad move Marriott

review.title: Good hotel but mean with Wi-Fi and towels
review.reviewText:
Overall this is a very good hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. But there were two penny-pinching things which we found annoying.

Firstly some of the bath towels were very thin, which is not what I would expect for a hotel of this calibre and charging the prices that it does. I expected to get nice thick bath towels, and that is not what we had.

Secondly there is free Wi-Fi in public areas but not in the rooms. If you want Wi-Fi in your room you have to pay extra for it. I know the hotel will say you get an extra fast broadband connection for this, but we simply wanted to be able to pick up our e-mail and look at a few web pages. Everywhere else we have stayed at you could do this for free, but not at the Marriot.

review.title: A great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was my second visit to San Francisco. I really enjoy this city! The climate is cool and can be cold at times so definitely pack a coat or sweatshirt. The food is always great and reasonably priced. You can always find cheap eats and there are very few chain restaurants. Definitely remember to pack your walking shoes. The city is full of hills and you need to be in shape. The city can be confusing without a map, so make sure you have a GPS on your phone. The graffiti art in the city is stunning. This isn't the stuff you see tagged along a roadside underpass. It is artwork and it's beautiful. If you want to see the sites, definitely schedule a bus tour. And make sure you schedule your visit to Alcatraz ahead of time. They typically sellout months in advance. I'd definitely recommend visiting many of the different ethnic districts (Mission, North Beach, Chinatown, etc..) and if you get a chance take the subway to Berkley. It's a really cool college town!

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Great hotel with a very friendly and accommodating staff. Walked to North Beach for great Italian food at Firenze By Night and Capo's. walked to AT&T Park for the Giants game.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square nearby as well as wonderful restaurants. Location was perfect!

review.title: Excellent Stay!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Marriott for 4 days for an extended anniversary weekend and it was fantastic! Previous reviews I had read had me a little worried about the size of the rooms and the hassle of having to use a safe deposit box at the front desk.....well all my worries were for nothing, all the rooms now have a safe in the room that held everything and the room was wonderful! great views and SUPER comfortable beds. The hotel was so well insulated that we didn't hear any outside noise and it was quiet and peaceful. The employees were ALL amazing and friendly - from the moment we pulled up, the valet, the doorman, the bartenders, the front desk personnel - they were all outstanding and made our stay wonderful! The location couldn't be any better! we were able to shop and eat all over Union Square,
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the staff were excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: the size of the bathroom was a little small for two people - and there was no counter space to store anything.
review.locationRemarks: Breakfast at Sears fine foods was amazing, dinner at Mortons steak house was the BEST!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great Location, Staff was extremely helpfull and very friendly. Trolly stops right of the corner of Sutter an Powell. But I would suggest buying the hop on hop off pass that the hotel recomends. The rooms were very nice great view the only negative thing for us was the bathroom was small, But I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: great restaurants in walking distance lots and lots of shopping. 24 hr walgreens right across the street

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Ok hotel, ok experience. Only negative was no free in room wifi

review.title: Perfectly situated.
review.reviewText: Perfectly situated, downtown San Francisco. Near everything you need: bars, restaurants, shops. You have also a 24h Walgreen at the corner. Really helpful when everything is close.
review.negativeRemarks: If you have a car, good luck. Lot of traffic.

review.title: Very friendly and helpful staff!
review.reviewText:
Because of my last name there are often issues with it getting mangled by various reservation systems. It took the staff some time to find my reservation and they graciously upgraded our room as an apology.

The room was fantastic, the staff overall was extremely helpful, and the location is awesomely next to the Powell cable car line and Sears restaurant is just across the street.

Highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, great rooms, great staff.
review.locationRemarks: Located right next to Powell cable car line with easy access to either end of fishermen's wharf.

review.title: Centrally located at Union Square
review.reviewText: To be honest - pretty mediocre. As a Marriott silver member I am used to a little more attention to the detail: e.g I requested another set of towels and canceled my request after the staff did not deliver it for more than 30 minutes. Upon checking out - if I do not get a smile, I at least expect to be asked how my stay was. Marriott still is a great hotel chain, but they need to pay more attention to the detail, otherwise they will lose customers to the competitors.
review.positiveRemarks: Standard of the room as expected from a Marriott. Very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Friendliness and attention of the staff

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The only negative thing about this hotel is we booked adjoining rooms on Expedia but ended up with one room with 2 double beds as the hotel said sorry but they were all fully booked which was very disappointing.
review.positiveRemarks: My favourite thing about this hotel is location location location
review.negativeRemarks: Not getting the adjoining rooms we paid for.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
They initially tried to give a different type of room, since they seem to have ran out of rooms with two double beds. After arguing with some of the employees (and the manager), we were finally able to get the room that we paid for.

There was no shower gel in the room (first hotel where this has happened to me) and they never gave us new supplies of shampoo and conditioner during our stay. Since we were three persons in the room, we ran out of them quickly.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union Square, so in the heart of San Francisco

review.title: Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText:
Nice clean hotel in Union Square
Rooms a little small but beds very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Wanted pancakes or waffles for breakfast buffet
review.locationRemarks: Cable car, lots of restaurants, exhibits at Union Square, shopping

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Can not beat the location/staff was great!
We did not have a safe or refrigerator in the room.
We were able to get a safe deposit box downstairs but it was not as easy as having one in the room.
Expensive for accommodations but guess you are paying for the location.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is right there if you want to be in the Tourist area. Accessible to transportation and can walk to many areas.

review.title: Great location, no mini-fridge
review.reviewText: Great location and very helpful staff. The hotel is very nice, clean, and the exersize room is fantastic. I only had two complaints about the room; 1. No mini fridge. We were on vacation and could have used one. 2. The closet in the room was not usable at all. I was surprised to see the the doors were slide by doors, which only allowed a few inches on either side to get into the closet. You could not put your suitcase in there if you wanted to, the doors should have been bi-fold doors. Other than that no complaints and again the staff was great.
review.negativeRemarks: No Mini-fridge and useless closet, the doors were slide by and only had access of a few inches on any side of the door.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of Union Square within easy walking distance of shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The staff was not very nice but the hotel room are really nice. The location of the hotel is really convenient
review.negativeRemarks: Staff

review.title: Nice hotel located in downtown area.
review.reviewText: I traveled in San Francisco with a group of friends. We selected this hotel mainly because it is located in the downtown area of San Francisco. It is very convenient for people to go shopping and sight-seeings.
review.positiveRemarks: The facilities are excellent and it is a nice choice for business people to host a conference here.
review.negativeRemarks: So far, so good.
review.locationRemarks: Union square is nearby and it is 10-15 minutes walk to the Moscone West Convention center.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I had a great time in SF and the hotel was great. The location was great with public transportation close by as well as convenient stores and coffee shops on the block. We will definitely stay in the Marriott Union Square again on our next visit.

review.title: Awesome stay
review.reviewText: Awesome stay,clean room,good size and friendly staff

review.title: Wonderful hotel close to shopping
review.reviewText: Loved the stay here. The room was really nice and fit 5 of us very perfectly. Staff was friendly and took care of us. The only pain was not being able to get a taxi that fit 5 people.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff very pleasant and helpful nothing too much trouble

review.title: I don't know how you could make it better
review.reviewText: The personnel at the hotel were awesome, second to none. Got a "Good Morning" and smile every day. It was our first trip to San Francisco. Everyone was very helpful with questions, dining recommendations, car rentals, whatever we needed. I liked the location. You can walk, if you want, to almost anything. Cable cars and public transportation right out front door. Rooms were nice and very clean. Comfortable beds and nice hot shower. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We were a family of four with two grown up children and we had a great time.

review.title: Great location, good value
review.reviewText: Good location, staff professional and friendly and room was comfortable but not terribly spacious...
review.negativeRemarks: size of room
review.locationRemarks: convenient to Union Square, Chinatown and Nob Hill

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Great location, clean and tidy . horrible beds! The "Queen" size bed is actually a full (or smaller, the mattress kept us up all night.

Otherwise, the hotel is very clean and well maintained, if you're looking for the best location in SF and do not mind a spring mattress than this hotel is perfect!

review.title: Great for a SF getaway!
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel for a trip to SF. Great location, can walk to numerous restaurants and shopping. Hotel has nice lobby bar and restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints.
review.locationRemarks: Doesn't get better!

review.title: Great hotel for location, functionality & service.
review.reviewText:
Great location. This is a great hotel for people who want to be at the center of things but do not require all the bells and whistles of a five-star hotel. The interior design is superb although understated. Someone with a great eye has made this Art-Deco combination of reds and greys. The lighting in the room is unique in its design, with recess lighting with dimmer control around the room about one foot below the high ceiling.. A stainless steel looking fan with a light in the middle controls the center of the ceiling. Again the controls are very adjustable. I actually would like to know who did the lighting design so that I can install it in my own house. Very tasteful and very functional.

The staff were very helpful.

The WiFi worked impeccably.

The only thing is that the walls are thin. When my neighboring guest woke me up at 4:30 on the morning , the desk staff immediately (this was my first compalint) offered to move me to another room.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, friendliness and competence of staff, location
review.negativeRemarks: THin walls
review.locationRemarks: Great Union Square location

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText: I will return to this hotel next time. The staff is very friendly, all the instalations of the hotel are very clean and it has excelent location.
review.locationRemarks: Excelent

review.title: Too small rooms
review.reviewText: The rooms are too small for 4 people... You should say that when people make reservations.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: Is great, near everthing!!!

review.title: Hotel with the best location!
review.reviewText: Room wasn't clean, found pieces of chewed chocolate in the floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Room wasn't clean
review.locationRemarks: Great Location, one block away of Union Square, two blocks away of Chinatown.

review.title: Excellently located...a great place for everyone!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very well located, it is about a block away from Union Square which is a great place to be. The staff are very helpful and pleasing. The hotel does need a bit of an upgrade but don't let that be a deterrence. It is also close to a lot of restaurants, shopping places and easily accessible.
It is ideal for families, couples and business travelers....we would surely stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Excellently locatted

review.title: good ,could be better
review.reviewText: good overall,but no fridge or saf box in the room, the room is clean but no free WiFi service except in the lobby . Breakfast was not included in the deal .

review.title: I had my lows, but there was a high.
review.reviewText:
Although check-in was quick and we were able to settle in town early, there were two things that bothered my stay. First, there was dried urine on the toilet; I was in a rush to use the bathroom so I covered it in tissue and used my anti-bacterial wipes to clean it after. Secondly, within 5 minutes of being in our room, the cleaning service suddenly opens the door because I guess they didn't know that we had checked-in early; shouldn't this have been a communication between the front desk and the cleaning service?
Overall, our stay was ok. This Marriott is in walking distance of great food and shops. Also, we checked out the view from the 30th floor, which was amazing!
review.negativeRemarks: Could've been a little bit more clean.
review.locationRemarks: Great walking distance for delicious food and plenty of shopping.

review.title: Thumbs up from nz
review.reviewText: Payed for a standard room was put on the 24th floor. Great view arrived in time for Black Friday sales very handy to shops will definitely stay again
review.positiveRemarks: Fast service and handy to Macy's union square
review.negativeRemarks: Wouldn't want to be on slower floor would be quite cold
review.locationRemarks: Very handy

review.title: Great place to be in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and quick in getting me checked into the hotel. The room, although small was very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. I was close to the cable cars and shopping. It was very well located to experience the best of San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Room was very small.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown Union Square

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was key for us and turned out to be a great spot. We were able to visit all the sights of interest by foot.
review.negativeRemarks: No pool
review.locationRemarks: Nice downtown location close to everything

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: It was a well appointed hotel which had all of the required amenities. It is very close to Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: great right near Union Square

review.title: Excellent location and great rooms
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. I love the Marriott chain of hotels. Never disappoints
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable rooms and pleasant staff
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, close to Union Sq, Tramps, and Buses

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: The parking fee is very expenser. The service is good
review.locationRemarks: Very good, excelent

review.title: Grumpy and unfriendly reception staff
review.reviewText: reception staff are rude and unfriendly; the porter did not help us with our bags when we arrived as we had to ask for assistance; on the morning we were due to check out at no later than 12noon we had housemaid at our door early and tried again a couple of times to see if we had left yet; the room we had booked was not 'available' when we arrived at 1.45pm and we waited at least 40 minutes at the reception desk whilst the woman in charge tried to find us the same room we had booked 4 months earlier on the internet and whilst she was doing this she was not only unpleasant but virtually blamed us for the delay because we had booked the room on Expedia and had not also telephoned the hotel to comfirm the booking as requested after we had booked online!!!! She wanted us to take a lesser quality room on the premise that the type of room we booked was not ready and then after 40 minutes when she could see we were not budging she sudfdenly found us the room type we had booked and yes, it was ready for us to use!!!
review.negativeRemarks: unfriendly staff
review.locationRemarks: central and convenient ti cable car and main shopping precinct

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: Overall a nice stay at the hotel, great location for shopping.

review.title: Perfect Place
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, close to everything, very clean and a very nice staff.

review.title: Marriot
review.reviewText: excellent staff, very knowledgeable and more than willing to be helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Very casual and relax atmosphere bar.
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, close to every tourist area and restaurants

review.title: Fantastic views of city and Bay area
review.reviewText: Excellent central position near Union Square with fantastic Bay and city views
review.locationRemarks: Just off Union Square so very handy for everything

review.title: Very convenient location
review.reviewText: Staff of hotel (front desk, concierge, bell men, etc) were as friendly, efficient and helpful as any I have ever encountered.

review.title: Luxury for the family
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Location was perfect. Rooms were clean and luxurious feeling.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Not in the center of the waterfront action, but very convenient to most things in town.

review.title: Fantastic Place!
review.reviewText:
It is a lovely place to stay. It's in a great location and very close to Union
Square. The beds were so comfortable and I would look forward to laying in that comfy bed after a day of touring San Fransisco. It was a great experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds and pillows were so plush and comfortable. Truly wonderful!
review.negativeRemarks: No Wifi in the rooms, you had to go down to the lobby to use the internet, which was chilly because they always have the doors open.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic! Right in the heart of the downtown, with Union Square so close by. You could walk to the Wharf and it was a great area of the city.

review.title: X
review.reviewText: Overpriced compared to the quality of the hotel and services

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: PERFECT location!!! Walgreens, Starbucks, and liquor store are all around the corner. Also within walking distance from restuarants and bars. We only use a cab once. The cable car picks up on Powell and takes you to fisherman's wharf too.

review.title: Works for families and central location
review.reviewText: We wanted a room for one night, close enough to Bart, yet with easy access to Fisherman's Wharf. Bus, cable car, and cab were all out front. Staff was very friendly, helpful, and always happy to give change! Easy to print your boarding pass if you need one. Room was very clean, great view, and quiet considering it's location.

review.title: Mom and Daughter weekend getaway...
review.reviewText:
Mom and Daughter weekend...Good location, clean updated rooms, friendly staff. very comfortable bed. Would definitely stay again. Walkable to shopping, dining, cable cars.
Marriotts usually do not disappoint. ;)

review.title: Positive Experience
review.reviewText: Always a nice stay at this hotel. The staff bends over backwards to make you feel like a wanted guest.
review.negativeRemarks: dinner accommodations
review.locationRemarks: one block off Union Square. Easy walking distance to most major attractions

review.title: San Francisco Marriott
review.reviewText: Very attentive employees. The room was clean and the bedding was comfortable and put together so we would know it was clean and safe. The bathroom was a little small, but not terrible. All of the other amenities were well thought out and convenient. Location was just right. The "Gym" was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from union square, perfect location to everything.

review.title: SF read our review
review.reviewText: Good location close to the shopping enter and china town. Parking was expensive like any other hotel. We rented a car. we did a lot of driving around to get to places we wanted to go. Expect to pay for parking everywhere you go. Food in SF is a hit and miss. Yelp was awful this time with fake ratings on a lot of the food places we went to. Those 4 stars are wrong! expect 2-3 stars for those 4 stars. Crab sandwiches was a disappointment over at the pier.

review.title: nice hotel but not returning
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel because it was close to Union square, we were there for the
Championship game , and on the Sunday left the hotel at 10am, we came back after game and late dinner at 10.30 pm, and to our exhausted eyes found our room was not done,
. called housekeeping and they sent somebody to do room in that moment, but it was not nice for the people they sent or for us to wait around when all we wanted was to put or feet up. nice hotel but it will be off my list, will return to the fairmont next time.
The 3 nights we were there, the bathroom sink was never cleaned, and refills for coffee never got there.
review.positiveRemarks: the concierge was very nice and helpful with info of best way to get to the game.
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: n/a

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Very good location. Close to Union Square and all the shops. lots of restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: the business center

review.title: Great place, great location!
review.reviewText: 5 stars across the board. Union Square area is great, staff was great. Nice bar, nice restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square for shopping, Fishermans Wharf for a fun area. Peir 39 was cool too.

review.title: Fantastic place to stay.
review.reviewText: Everything I had hoped for our weekend in SF. Killer view from the 23rd floor.
review.locationRemarks: This Hotel is right between Union Sq and China Town, Take you time and walk thru both.

review.title: Great trip
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect. We had a great trip and would go back in a second.

review.title: Perfect location, superb hotel, ticks all the boxes
review.reviewText:
The hotel is one block back from Union Square so it's fairly quiet but very central. Walking distance to the Wharf, China Town, North beach and all the major bus and trolley routes pass nearby.
Beds are really comfy and the rooms are big for a city centre hotel.
An in-room safe would have been useful (although you can put valuables in the hotel safe at the main desk). Otherwise perfect!

review.title: Good hotel, but...
review.reviewText: Good hotel, but too expensive for the room I was staying. Although the room was spotless, the bathroom was very small and the room was very plain. I couldâ€™ve booked the similar room for less money in the cheaper hotel. The king bed was very comfortable though

review.title: San Fran Marriott Union Square
review.reviewText: Highly recommend this hotel. Request a room on an upper floor as you get great views. The room was good sized and very clean. Best thing was it was very quiet, and the bed was fantastic. Cable car stop out front of hotel, Starbucks across the street with free WiFi. I travel for a living and this hotel exceeded my expectations.

review.title: Awesome area!
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a fantastic area. The rooms are awesome, and the view is terrific!

review.title: Outstanding Hotel
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco and we decided to go there to celebrate our 40th Wedding Anniversary. After checking the reviews on many of the hotels, we decided to take a chance on this one. As it turns out, we made a wonderful choice! Everything was fantastic, from the check-in, spacious room, unbelieveably Comfortable bed, cleanliness, beautiful view of the bay, convenience to restaurants, cable cars, and all attractions, and also a very courteous and helpful staff. They even surprised us with a bottle of champagne from Napa Valley and a handwritten card congratulating us on our 40th Anniversary! We would definitely stay there again! And we were so impressed with our stay (our first time in a Marriott) that when we travel again we will look for a Marriott .

review.title: shasha
review.reviewText: great location, very convinient

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. Clean room with comfortable beds. Fairly priced and right in the middle of Union Square. It was just a few blocks from the BART station. From San Fran Airport, on the BART ($8.10) out and a short walk to the hotel. What could be better?

review.title: My favorite hotel of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I had a great experiance in San Francisco. San Francisco Marriott Union Square is good hotel in San Francisco for us. We could good memory with my family. I would like to stay San Francisco Marriott Union Square again.
Thank you.

review.title: San Francisco Treat
review.reviewText: Our hotel was conveniently located near Union Square. Across the street from the hotel on the corner of Powell and Sutter was the Cable Car which takes you to Fisherman's Wharf. Also, the hotel was only a couple of blocks away from all the shopping in Union Square. SF's Chinatown is within walking distance. The Concierge Desk was very helpful - arranging for a rental car, advising us how to get to the football game and general directions. Though there seemed to be a lot of registered guests, I found the hotel quiet. The hotel room was comfortable and Housekeeping did a very good job cleaning it every day. My only complaint is the Marriott chain does not offer free internet. And their fee for 15 minutes I found very expensive.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText:
We really enjoyed our weekend staying at the Marriott Union Square. The hotel was warm and inviting with a door man, nice common areas, and a healthy buzz of people in the lobby.
The room was clean and comfortable with a nice view of the city and a glimpse of the bay. Not the largest room I have stayed in but very comfortable for a dense metro like San Francisco.

We enjoyed our stay and recommend this hotel!

review.title: Good place to stay for a get away.
review.reviewText: This hotel is good. We just stayed for the weekend and it is the perfect location to enjoy Union Square and China Town.

review.title: Marriott Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice and comfortable hotel. A good option if you don't care for the cramped quaint older boutique hotels. Great location.

review.title: IF WE HAVE CHANE, WE WILL GO BACK
review.reviewText: IF WE HAVE CHANE, WE WILL GO BACK, service isgoodï¼Œconventionï¼

review.title: Very Disappointed.
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was rude at check in. No in room safe. No in room fridge. Bell person VERY rude. Tried to convince our party of five to use a cab with 4 seat belts. When we said we weren't comfortable with that he ignored us - for the next 3 days!!!!! On duty manager didn't even look up from what he was doing when I tried to express our concerns. He went on to tell me it was "illegal for a cab to take 5 pasengers in San Francisco". Rubbish! We found mini van cabs for the rest of our stay without too much trouble. Marriotts are usually wonderful and although the location was great will not be returning to the Marriott Union Square.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is situated right next to Union Square with Cable Car stop right next door. Shops are a short distance away with Macys, Saks and Barneys within 5 minute walk. The hotel itself is very clean and staff are accommodating. The only negative feedback i can give is that it seems that when other guests close their doors, it slams and the wall in my room vibrates. This is most annoying in the mornings when you're still trying to get more sleep. Otherwise, I am very satisfied with my stay.

review.title: Was Terrific
review.reviewText: Everything was terrific: the location, the staff, the cleanliness and the room. We'd definitely return.

review.title: very nice, and very good location
review.reviewText:
We stayed for 4 days for our vacation trip in the west.
This hotel was clean, without any noise, and very well located.
If you are renting a car for a trip to several places, do not keep the car while you are at the hotel, first you do not need it, there is a lot of public transportation which are very efficient, second the parking is crazy expensive.
Other than that the hotel was very great, we were with a 11 month baby and everything was perfect.

review.title: Great location-
review.reviewText: Great Hotel and location. I picked it because Starbucks was right across the street but wound up being so happy with where we were located and the hotel. Best beds and bedding. Hotel is small with a small lobby so if you are looking for more this isnt it. Everyone was helpful, room was clean but no safe in room. I would definitely stay there again and i am very picky about the rooms I stay in especially the linens and they were great. Cant wait to go again!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
super comfy beds, hotel staff helpful, within walking distance to several tourist attractions, and cable car pick up right across street for those attractions not wilthin walking distance.
plenty of restaurants nearby, hotel food pricy but tasty. great area for the shopper. Loved walking to chinatown and union square.

review.title: Beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great central location, very reasonably priced with lovely, clean rooms! I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great time minutes from everthing
review.reviewText:
Had a great stay, we were able to check in early which was great as we were already up for 15 hours even though san fran time it was one, the room was comfy, clean, everyone was polite. you had plenty of places to eat near by, Lori diner, a great sushi place around the corner that the name escapes me. other restuarants near by. The muni, and Bart are 8 blocks away, macy's is around the corner as well as other stores like Prada for you shoppers out there.THe trolley is right out side on the corner if you are planning on going to fisherman's wharf..

All and All great hotel

review.title: Last leg of our pacific coastal drive
review.reviewText:
The attitude of the check-in person was not what we had come to expect as this was the last hotel out of 5 on our holiday, and the most expensive. We found that this person was abrupt, they made no eye contact, and seemed to rush us through the check in proccess, although there was no one else waiting, and they were just generally was not welcoming. Later as we left to go out, the hotel offered loan umbrellas, the person in charge was rude and unhelpful.
As we arrived at the hotel by car, we unloaded the car and were offered valet parking, we accepted as we did not know the area. We had a shock the following morning when we found that the overnight parking is charged at $45 plus tax - Â£35, what made this so bad was that we found a car park no more than 50yards around the corner for $26 - or Â£16 for 24hrs. It just put a bit of a damper on the last leg of the holiday.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a week on holiday. Spacious, nicely decorated room with 2 double beds. Good view from the 21st floor. No minibar or in-room safe but they were happy to provide a fridge up to our room on request. Great location, one block from Union Square. Starbucks and Wallgreens accross the street.

review.title: Marriott Union Square San Francisco - Great Stay!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The accommodation was very comfortable with 2 kids, my wife and I surprised at the space in a central city hotel. The doorman Fernandez was a gem, even before we gave him a tip! The hotel is only 1 block from Union Square, smack bang in the middle of the specialty shopping area and across the road from the Cable Car stop.

review.title: Sal
review.reviewText:
Great location,friendly staff,Nice and clean room,cozy bed.
ENjoyed my stay .
no free internet and fridge

review.title: Very comforting hotel
review.reviewText:
It was raining the day we traveled.
We were so satisfied of hotel because it was clean and warm.
The customer service was quite good.
The view was also good..
I'm so happyyy.

review.title: Great Stay!!!
review.reviewText: Close to shopping. Great location. Nice hotel.

review.title: SF Marriott Union Square
review.reviewText: Convenient location, walking distance from shopping, restaurants, galleries, SFMOMA, Yerba Buena, Chinatown, Jewish Museum. Short bus ride to other city locations. Recently renovated, everything new and shiny. Most courteous and attentive staff I've ever encountered in the U.S. Even maids made polite conversation in hallways.

review.title: Great Location Near Union Square
review.reviewText: My overall stay at the San Francisco Marriott Union Square was more than satisfactory. I was very happy with the overall cleanliness and accessibility of the hotel room, and the condition of the amenities. I especially liked the convenient location of the hotel - which was easy to find - right on the corner of Powell and Sutter Streets. The hotel is close to Union Square, Nob Hill, as well as Chinatown, and taxis were easily accessible. The location is nice for the reason that it is close to everything, but not right in the middle of all the chaos. The only inconvenience I did experience during my stay was that there was no refrigerator in my room. I'm not sure if all the rooms have no fridge, but it would've been nice to have one.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location for visiting friends at the Academy of Art and also many attractions. I would recommend to family and friends traveling to San Francisco!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The room was nice, but the housekeepers didn't understand when we said we didn't want any service. They knocked 4 times & called twice asking if we were sure we didn't want them to clean the room. That was annoying.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a perfect spot to explore downtown San Francisco. It was half a block from were you can take the cable cars and a short walking distance from Union Square. People were friendly at the hotel. They cleaned it early in the mornig around 10 am. The only thing lacking was a refrigerator in the room and they never brought the paper to our room. Other than that it was a great experience.

review.title: Nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: There were a few minor items that disapointed me in my room. However, the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever had. The staff members were all very helpful and cheerful. Very willing to provide assistance and help you get oriented.

review.title: One very satisfied guest
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at Mariott Union Square. Location of this hotel is perfect, within waking distance to bart, cable car and buses stop. The room is pleasing to view, and confortable to stay. Bed is very confortable. Travellers need to be aware that the there is extra charge to use internet and of course, parking is not free at the hotel.

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: I got a quiet room, as requested, immediately upon check in. The people were all very friendly. Ideally located in the middle of Downtown. Excellent fare.

review.title: Union Square at its best!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! We loved the location. If you love to shop and browse the stores in Union Square, you must stay at this Marriott! Room was immaculate and service was excellent.

review.title: Highly recommended to breakfast lovers - excellent breakfast services!
review.reviewText:
- Clean room and good location - close to most of the shops in Union Square & China Town, only few minutes walk.
- Excellent service in the cafe for breakfast. Staff are very helpful and quick in service action. It's the best breakfast experience in my 20+ years of business & personal travel.
- Only problem is weak tap water for shower and no public telephone available in the lobby.

review.title: Great location.
