review.reviewText: The staff was very accomodating and early check-in made it convenient. The room very nice and very clean.

review.title: The best beds in town
review.reviewText: A great hotel right in the heart of the town.A lovely spacious room with the softest mattress topper I've ever slept on.Even the complementary shampoo etc was aromatherapy based and a cut above the norm. Lovely views from the top floor rooms and right next to a Starbucks , a trolley stop and one block from Macy's what more would you need!

review.title: great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: very comfortable beds, great view from upper floors, wonderful location, very friendly, helpful staff, will definately stay here again

review.title: Served the purpose well.
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located near where we wanted to be downtown. It was near enough to transportation where we traveled to the Wharf and different parts of town. The room was very nice and comfortable.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: Good Hotel, pricey but good

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText:
Nestled between the lively Union Square shopping area and also within walking distance of Chinatown, this hotel is great for the business traveler and vacationer as well.

Friendly staff, nice clean rooms and good firm beds.

review.title: Great Recently Renovated 4 Star
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great location. We paid a little extra for the panoramic view to get high above the city street noise and we stayed on the 26th floor. The entire hotel was very clean and newly renovated. Staff was extremely nice. We were able to check-in early at noon which was nice. Room was comfortable cnd clean. Would definitely return.

review.title: Union Square experience
review.reviewText: I booked two rooms at the SF Marriott Union Square and was very happy with the hotel and accommodations. The hotel is one block off the square but is still centrally located for shopping. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, assigning us rooms on the same floor. My room had a fabulous view of Nob Hill, China Town, Coit Tower and the bay. I couldn't have asked for more!

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: good, clean and curtious

review.title: Will go back.
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable, clean and beautiful.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, great location, will definitely stay there again!

review.title: Nice but very noisy
review.reviewText: While the San Francisco Marriott Union Square offers all the amenities we can expect from a Marriott hotel, it is one of the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed at. It is located at the intersection of two busy streets (Powell and Sutter) and the rooms facing the street lack double windows. It is otherwise a very nice hotel.

review.title: Excellent alternative at a fair price
review.reviewText: Just redecorated. Excellent location. Good price. Fair service

review.title: great staff
review.reviewText: Great location, great Filipino staff. Newspaper delivery is inconsistent. Beds are the best!!!!

review.title: Parking fees
review.reviewText: I didn't like the hidden parking fees. Wasn't a problem to pay, it was just a shock to pay so much for staying at the hotel when I could have payed the same price at any garage around the city.

review.title: New hotel, good choice
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly new, even so new, that the taxi driver didn't know about it. So all the furniture and everything else is sparkling new and clean. The staff was friendly, I even felt almost uncomfortable by always having someone opening the front door for me. As always, I hated paying for internet access, this was no different. I also used the gym, which is huge, brand new and very well equipped. The best hotel gym I've been to. The reception desk staff was friendly, but I did have some difficulties understanding them, with the hotel being just outside of Chinatown. The price was good, considering that a shaky place next to my conference place was just a few bucks cheaper and considering the big ol' Marriott on 4th Street is substantially more expensive.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a great location. Very helpful concierge. A bargain for the weekend.

review.title: overpriced for what you get
review.reviewText: The hotel has a nice location if what you're doing is near union square. The staff was courteous, and professional. The room was clean yet lacked a fan or a/c also a refrigerator. I understand it's downtown SF, but still overpriced for the room we got, when I stayed in a nicer room in Hawaii for less money.

review.title: So close to everything
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great find. Only a short walk to Union Square. Cable cars outside on the corner, and Lori's Diner across the road. Walgreens (supermarket/chemist) on opposite corner. Starbucks across the road. For 2 Aussies travelling, this was a perfect location to stay. Found it very easy to get around and do all the touristy stuff. Loved the room, bed was soooo comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Very nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the hotel. The staff were very kind and always ready to help. Room was very nice and comfortable.

review.title: Not impressed- it was renovation period
review.reviewText: the parking of the hotel is so expensive per day so they direct you to other parking area for cheap price. renovation all around the Lobby and the main entrance.

review.title: Looking for an excellent Hotel in San Francisco?
review.reviewText: The hotel was renovated. We enjoyed the very nice new rooms a lot. The staff is excellent, very friendly and supportive. The breakfast buffet was outstanding.

review.title: Aside from the construction this hotel was perfect for our weekend.
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little off of Union Square, the upper floors have great views and it is easy walking distance to shopping and restaurants. Held our luggage after check-out so we could shop. It is under construction, so the aesthetics weren't perfect, but you could not hear anything 25 floors up!

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Even though the hotel lobby and front area were under construction, our stay was still wonderful. I would love to stay there again when the construction is completed. It is in an excellent location. I have no complaints. Would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Perfect Location for San Francisco
review.reviewText: My wife and I needed a place to stay that was close to everything in San Francisco because she was 5 months pregnant with triplets when we were there. We couldn't have picked a better location (even if she wasn't pregnant - this hotel is in the perfect location). Just outside the front door is the world famous Cable Cars to take you to Fishermans Warf. Just two blocks from Union Square and tons of shopping (my wife loved that). Four blocks from the transit system that takes you along the Embarcadero. To top it off, this hotel had recently been remodeled and the rooms were so well designed for our comfort. Best hotel we have ever stayed in.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: During my stay Mar 24-28, 2009, the hotel (former Hotel 480) was being renovated. So, I could hear some noises during the daytime. A room was very clean and nice, but a bathroom is not big enough. The worst thing of this hotel is that a maid unlocks a door and comes in your room at 10:00 AM!!!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a GREAT location, 1 block north of Union Square. The rooms was very nice, I got a free upgrade to a higher room with a better view. Beds were very comfy, bathroom was cool - it had an asian-like sliding glass door. Handy tip: Park at the Sutter Stockton Garage, about a half block east. I parked there for 24 hours and only paid $17. My friends parked at the hotel and paid $50. Wow. One thing was the hotel was doing construction in the front by the street. Lot's of concrete dividers and dust. Hopefully it will be completed soon.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: I guess we got a deal because the hotel was still in transition from Hotel 480 to Marriott. There was a little construction finishing up in the lobby, but it didn't bother us at all. The whole hotel has been completely renovated. Consequentally, the rooms are really nice, and the beds were really comfortable. The location can't be beat either... a few blocks from the Powell Street BART Station, right next to the famous cable car lines, and right in the heart of San Francisco. The part that we weren't expecting... a really sweet view from the huge bay window in our room. We could even see Coit Tower from our room. Very cool.

review.title: Hotel 480 (becoming Marriott)
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel. It is comfortable, clean, conveniently located, and with renovated tooms. The staff were all courteous and accommodating. The rooms have LCD flatscreen TV's, with accessible input jacks so you can connect a portable DVD player. The renovations were still in progress, outside guest rooms, most noteably on the sidewalk in front of the building...HEAVY work was going on while I was there and the walkway configuration was different every day. BUT, I expect that is mostly complete by now, so shouldn't be an annoyance to new guests. The Marriott sign was put on the wall while I was there, but was covered by a veil...if you walk under it, you can clearly see it is Marriott but as of 28 March in the evening they had not yet taken the veil off. Watch for Expedia deals...I was able to get a very nice rate indeed.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This is a super nice hotel in a fantastic location. The beds are extremely comfy and the rooms are plenty big. The bathroom was pretty small, but it really wasn't a problem. There is also a large desk and sitting area near the window. The rooms have internet, but it is ethernet and expensive. There is no refrigerator. I would recommend looking for a deal at this hotel over the next couple of months while they are still renovating the lobby. It feels like a really expensive hotel, but right now you can stay here for a reasonable price. There are also coupon codes out there to help lower the price of this hotel even further. The location is fantastic. You are one block from Union Square; a short walk to the ferry building, the business district, Chinatown, and North Beach; and, close to the BART and Cable Cars. I read another helpful review that suggested calling to request a specific bed size and higher floor. I did this and was redirected from the front desk to a message system and was pretty leery. But, I left a message anyway and they got back to me promptly AND granted my requests once I got to the hotel. My reservations changed from a double bed to a king bed and I was placed on a high floor on the north side of the building with a great view of the Bay. All in all it was a great hotel and I would definitely recommend it. Just try to catch it before it costs as much as it's actually worth!

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: Great location Newly renovated clean and comfortable room very helpful staff

review.title: Great people!
review.reviewText: This was my third visit to San Francisco and was the best hotel overall. The people here are very friendly and helpful. The room was also nice. Not so big but suficient. The bed was confortable and I had a good night sleep every night, which is really important especially if you're on a business trip. The hotel is little far from the center part of shopping, but only a few blocks away.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Some construction was going on, but overall a great hotel. Once the lounge is open it will be even better. Can't beat the location. Rooms were very comfortable. Would recommend.

review.title: Incrediblevalue; great location!
review.reviewText: Brand spanken new and well-appointed

review.title: Will go back again
review.reviewText: The location is convenient. The interior is excellent. The lobby renovation did not bother us at all.

review.title: Internet
review.reviewText: I was disappointed with the internet sevice. I don't think anyone should have to pay for wifi at a hotel these days. I shouldn't have to go two blocks down the street to get free wifi. I lugged my laptop for nothing.

review.title: Loved, loved, loved it. One of San Fran's best.
review.reviewText: We spent our 25th Wedding Ann. at the 480 Hotel. They gave us a complimentary upgrade. The quality of the room, service and atmosphere,by far, the best we have ever had in San Francisco. We vacation in San Fran once a year, every year since 1996, so we have stayed at several hotels there, both in the City and on the Wharf. We will for sure, stay at the 480 Hotel on our next trip and many more to come. Don't hesitate to stay there, it's terrific and an excellant location, right at Union Square.

review.title: Great place to stay in Sazn Francisco.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, even though they had construction going on. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Great location-near the cable car route and lots of eateries in the area. Walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square.

review.title: Will stay on the same hotel when I go back to S.F.!
review.reviewText: The room was clean and the bed was so comfortable.Staff are friendly.Overall,my stay was excellent,except for the ongoing,construction when you enter the hotel but when you go to your room ,I can't hear anything.i was impress with the cleanliness of the room.

review.title: perfect fit
review.reviewText: this hotel was perfect, we stay 8 nights which would have been miserable if we didn't like it. As everyone says there was ongoing construction so the restaurants weren't open and only 2 of the 4 elevators were running (my biggest complaint because it took a little while) but it is the IDEAL location, rooms are large with flat screen tvs, the gym is great, and there is transportation (cable cars) litterally across the street. the best thing is that it is becoming a marriot ($$$$$$) but that during the transition process the room prices are WAY down

review.title: Beautiful room in a great location.
review.reviewText: It felt like we were the first ones staying in this newly renovated room right in Union Square. While part of the lobby was still under construction, it had no effect on our stay.

review.title: Very good service.
review.reviewText: Very good service.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Will be wonderful when completed, especially at such a great price!!!!!!!!! Staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Hotel lobby was in transition so not much furniture to sit on. But I could see that it was going to be very contemporay when finished. The gal at the front wasn't very friendly the night we checked in - she looked like she was in the middle of a project. However, the Asian doorman was terrific! Contemporary room was beautifully decorated, bed extremely comfortable, bathroom spacioius and lovely.

review.title: Staff was excellent!
review.reviewText: Staff was incredible. Made our stay extremely comfortable. From making dinner reservations to helping us decide how to spend our days, they made it seem like we were the only guests in the hotel. Once they complete the renovation, the hotel will be world class!

review.title: Under construction til early april
review.reviewText: Under construction That's why the condition of the hotel was questionable. Looks like when they complete the renovations (late this month or early April) it will be quite nice. Very convenient to the restaurants, shops in the Union Sq area.

review.title: Nice room
review.reviewText: I was very happy with the size and comforts of the room. Valet is a hassle but San Fran is a bad place for cars. The buisness trveler should be very happy here.

review.title: excellent location brilliantly priced
review.reviewText: Even though in process of renervation it was very clean and not dusty.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Hotel 480 is perfectly located, one block from Union Square, shopping, cable cars, bus, restaurants and car rentals. Hotel 480 is safe, very clean, newly renovated, and quiet. Good beds.

review.title: Great hotel.... perfect location
review.reviewText: Still under construction for major renovation which was somewhat of an inconvenience, but overall good experience and would go there again.

review.title: A great deal, a great stay
review.reviewText: Even though the outside lower floors are still being renovated, and there is construction fabric covering them, the inside is renovated, attractive, clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfy. No room-to-room noise. Cable car stops at the door and across the street you will find a 24-hour drug store and a great diner for breakfast. Close to Chinatown and the highlights of Powell St, this was a great place to base our stay in San Francisco. I would go back. Only suggestion - since there is no counter in the bathroom due to the pedestal sink, a few more shelves would be nice.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Awsome views from our room, this will be the place to stay on our next visit to SF. The staff was helpful, friendly, overall great. Highly recomend it.

review.title: Great Place, great location...can't wait to return
review.reviewText: Hotel 480 was a wonderful hotel in a great city. The cable car line right outside of the hotel provide easy access to many of the city's vibrant neighborhoods.

review.title: Great Hotel in great Location
review.reviewText: Everything was great even though they are remodeling; No sounds can be heard from construction in the room. 24 hr Walgreens a few feet away along w/ a trolly stop. Great Location!!!

review.title: Best choice with reasonable price
review.reviewText: Oustanding location near Union Square, excellent service and confort room

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: The renovations that the hotel is under going provided a great bargain rate and we never noticed any disturbances.

review.title: Bast location downtown
review.reviewText: The hotel is coveniently located next to Union Square. The room is conpact and clean. It is good for short stay.

review.title: very reasonable and convenient at the heart of the San Francisco
review.reviewText: Pls complete the rennovation. Also wipe the window outside. Then everything will be fine!!

review.title: Its a good deal
review.reviewText: The hotel is already renovated. The room is clean, functional and size is adequate for up to two person. Location is great. For the price, its a real bargain.

review.title: Under construction
review.reviewText: The hotel was currently under construction to re-vamp the lobby and restaurant area. This made it a little hard to find the hotel. Also, the front desk staff wasn't very friendly. They seemed very rigid. The maid staff was very, very nice. Even with the construction you couldn't hear any of it in the rooms. It was a nice hotel.

review.title: BEAUTIFUL ROOMS WITH WONDERFUL COMFORTS AND THE BEST BEDS!
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel late October. The hotel is being upgraded so there is alot of a scaffolding on the building so on our arrival was disappointed from the outside. The lobby was still to be renovated. Once we opened the door to our room......extremely impressed......huge rooms with gorgeous decor and toiletries provided. Very impressed. I booked a double/double room for 4 people, 2 adults and 2 children and it was great, the beds are an overside double and the room huge. The hotel is in an excellent position, 1 block from Union Sq! Also on the adjacent corner there is Lori's Diner, an original American Diner, great food, service and price, lots of fun. On the other corner is a Walmart, handy for drinks and snacks. The only negative was that the staff on Reception always seemed to be unhappy, if you asked them a question you felt like you were in their way. All in all we had a great stay and will definitely go back to this hotel again.

review.title: great hotel great location
review.reviewText: Nicely reno'd rooms. fabulous location

review.title: good deal for a quality hotel
review.reviewText: This was my frist trip back to the bay area since I left 3 years ago. I had a wonderful stay at the hotel. The room was really nice and comfortable and the hotel staff was overall very accomodating. The hotel is undergoing a remodel which is probably why I got such a great deal for it. It is very conviently located in the heart of Union Square and only a couple of blocks from the Powell St. Bart station. My only real complaint was that parking is ridiculously expensive ($50+ per night), but it is like that everywhere in San Francisco. I would recommend parking your car at a different lot, there are cheaper ones around in the area (ranging $30-$40 a night) or not brining a car at all if possible. My other complaints are minor ones, there is no full length mirror in the room so my friend and I stood on the bed to see ourselves in the mirror. Also, the bathroom has just a sliding glass door which doesn't much provide much privacy. Other than that, I wonderful stay and will likely come back again, if the prices stay the same!

review.title: Great Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: External facade is being renovated at the moment but we never heard any noise concerning the building works. Room was comfortable and staff friendly. Book early to get best rate.

review.title: Great place for a city week-end
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful choice for us. The rooms were spacious compared to other downtown hotels, everything was close by and we were able to shop, go out dancing, have great meals and relax. The staff was friendly and everything was easy and went smoothly.

review.title: Excellent Newly Remodel Room
review.reviewText: New and remodel room is comfortable with large Flat screen TV. The hotel is undergoing remodeling so it is noisy during the day but is quiet in the evening. Close to everything, shoppings & dinings, Chinatown, Macy are all within walking distance. A 24 hr Walgreens is across the street. Very convenient. Self Park in the Sutter & Stockton Garage one block away for more reasonable rate. Concierge is very knowledgeable. Overall, a good stay for a reasonable rate.

review.title: A nice place to stay in the city
review.reviewText: The hotel location is very good, very close to shopping area and restaurant. Hotel's room is very comfortable and very clean.

review.title: It was just okay
review.reviewText: I know there were few problems due to renovation, but that does not give them excuses to lower the qualisty of services they provide.It was just okay, I won't stay again though.

review.title: Great location - a lot of construction
review.reviewText: The hotel is currently undergoing a major construction effort. If you're only looking for a place to sleep at night, it is a great choice. We stayed in a remodeled room and everything is new. Location can't be beat if you are visiting as a tourist.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great location, clean & comfortable rooms. We didn't use many of the other amenities. The hotel was being renovated, but the construction was only during the day and we were out most of the days, so it didn't affect us. Highly recommend the place.

review.title: Location, Location and Location
review.reviewText: This is the 9th Hotel we checked into over a 4 weeks period and by far the more comfortable (comparing to the other "Big Named" ones we stayed)as well. This being given the "renovated" room where everything is almost brand new and size (big) is the matter. Staff members have been attentive and friendly as well and location (walking distance) cannot be better. Only thing is the thin door/wall and insufficient hanging hooks/rails in the bathroom. Also, it will be nice to have an addional coffee table (certainly more than enough space for that) as well.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Clean room and bathroom with very comfortable beds.

review.title: Not as good as it seem to be on the internet
review.reviewText: Large clean room, small bathroom and we had a quite nice view (18th floor). No construction noise although you can see it is beeing renovated. However the welcoming was really not warm at all. Except a coffee maker in the room, little things that make you feel in a 4 stars hotel are limited, and I have tested several ones in this area.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms are clean, generously sized, and the beds are great. Working area, desk, electronics, etc, especially nice. Parking not on site and up steep hill. Very close to Union Square. Highly recommended

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: New rooms,great location and a great value (as a result of the remodeling). The construction was only a minor distraction, but obviously not for those with inflated egos and needs. Value buyers take note ... Our only complaint is that we wished for another mirror in the room besides the one in the bathroom ... other than that it was a great room.

review.title: The Price Was Right
review.reviewText: Ongoing renovations did not interfere at all. Rooms a little too small for four people. No fan in the bathroom or safe in the room but excellent shower. Expensive to use internet. Staff was pleasant but not interested in being too helpful. Great location and cheaper parking next door with in-out privileges. A good value for the money.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is being renovated, but there was no negative impact on our stay. The level we were on had been completely updated and was new and clean. The location was very convenient - lots of restaurants, shopping options and easy access to transport. The cable car stop is just outside the hotel. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Renovating the Outside
review.reviewText: Hotel is very conveneintly located near Union Square in S.F. Can walk to many attractions, shopping and BART.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at Hotel 480 Union Square - looking forward to my third and fourth.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Located near Union Square Shopping district, rooms look very nice and clean. I felt very secure, because I heard that some places in SF were filled with bums and drug dealers, this was not one of those places. A little bit on the expensive side, but worth it. Walls were a little thin and could hear closing of nearby doors. Parking is $46 and the valet will let you do ins and outs, but I'd probably take a taxi or walk because parking on the street is near impossible and expensive. Just leave the car there overnight and pick it up when you leave.

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: My wife and I enjoyed our 3 night stay in the hotel. The room was cosy and comfortable. Our friends had recommended the hotel to us and we would recommend the hotel too. The staff was also very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Excellent Deal, Perfect ocation
review.reviewText: The hotel is currently under renovation, and the Hotel 480 name is interime until the renovations is complete and it opens as a Marriott. Though they are renovating, the only visible impact is the lobby area. That's the only reason that they had a lower mark for condition/maintenance, but it really isn't an issue. The rooms are substantially complete, and provide the standard and consistent comfort and very good level of service as you'd expect from Marriot. The location is excellent, you really can't get much better. While the hotel is still branded Hotel 480 I suspect that the rates will remain discounted...so make a booking while you can, before it changes to Marriott and the rates go up!! It's a very very good hotel choice for SFO, and I will continue to stay there on future business (or leisure) trips.

review.title: Very impressive for a pack I've never heard of
review.reviewText: Really low key but upscale hotel. They are doing construction in lobby which was a bit of a annoyance but wasn't too big a deal after 5pm. Room is very modern with LCD screen and input jacks at desk. Nice sliding door bathroom and furnishings.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: My husband & I stayed at Hotel 480 for 3 nights in mid November. The hotel was under-going major renovations which we knew about. Without asking we were given one of the ultra modern renovated rooms on the higher floors with fantastic views. There is still much to be done in terms of up-grading the place. Location wise, it's the perfect base from which to explore the city. It's a short stroll on the right side of town from the shopping district. It's practically on the doorstep of China Town. And for those not shy of walking, it's possible to walk all the way to Fisherman's Wharf. For people wishing to explore beyond the city at their own steam, there is a National/Alamo car rental place one block away up the hill.

review.title: Great hotel, best location
review.reviewText: The hotel was under renovation so the exterior is plastered up and some of the floors are blocked, but this didn't impact our stay -- the room was comfortable and clean, and the hotel is in the best location in San Francisco, one block from Union Square, 5 blocks from the BART, and right on a cable car line. In-room internet is fast and reliable but costs extra. A microwave and fridge in the room would have been useful, but it's not that kind of hotel.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hotel 480...They're remodeling the hotel and it will soon become a Marriott. The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms were tastefully decorated. I checked in late at night and the desk clerk put me on a high floor with a view of the bay. The staff were very professional throughout my stay and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. It's in Union Square so restaurants and shopping are right out your front door.

review.title: Hotel under reconstruction
review.reviewText: We are very experienced San Francisco hotel users. The new Hotel 480 has had many reincarnations in the past it was a Holiday Inn and Waterbury (at least). The reconstruction is, essentially, painless for guests. The front desk is a little frazaled but OK check-in. Room very comfortable, relatively large (for San Francisco), quiet, good AC/heat. Nice linen, comfortable beds, thin bath towels, small bath. Very convenient (right on Powell a short block from Union Sq.) Lori's (cafe) and Starbucks right next-store. Paper at the door each morning and good in-room coffee (now that's unusual). Minus: No free WiFi. Who charges for this now-a-days?? No coffee in lobby.

review.title: Under construction
review.reviewText: Although the room was newly upgraded the hotel was under major reconstruction. We should have been alerted to this fact.

review.title: Good choice!
review.reviewText: They are doing major remodelling on the exterior and so it's easy to miss seeing from the street that this is a hotel. It's clean, comfortable and conviently located on Sutter & Powell. I'm neither young nor in the best of shape, but I did easily walk the few blocks to Chinatown and also to Union Square and some other nearby places. Staff very pleasant. I had one meal and several ginger ales in the quiet hotel bar.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a weekend getaway and it was great. Even thought the front of the hotel was being renovated, it did not really inconvenience us at all. The hotel lobby and our room both looked new and clean. The service was also excellent, from the valet, to check-in and housekeeping. They even provided a fridge upon request so that we could keep milk for the 18 month old. Our room was bigger, and I think nicer, than the room we had gotten at the Hyatt Regency across the street which we had stayed at before. And we got this one at about 1/3 the price of the Hyatt. Close to Union Square and Chinatown. I would definitey stay here again.

review.title: not impress at all
review.reviewText: this hotel was under reconstruction so we have some dificults in the entrence

review.title: everything was great
review.reviewText: except that the package did not have breakfast included. or, at least, this is what i was told. the hotel also doesn't have yet a larger lobby where you could work. perhaps this will be there after the renovations. otherwise, the design of the room was great, like everything else. i would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great pick
review.reviewText: Great location, convenient to all the Union Square area attractions (so great for shopping and Chinatown). They are under long-term construction, but it wasn't a problem at all. Staff was friendly and attentive. Actually got a really sweet update to a room that is bigger than my apartment. Heads up for you non-city folk: this hotel is on two busy streets (one of which has cable cars running on it). From my 6th floor you could hear everything from the street level. Noise didn't start until 6-7am and went on until 11-midnight.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: rooms very clean and remodeled, great location, near to good restaurants and shops, nice & friendly people. thank you 480 hotel

review.title: Nice hotel, terrific location
review.reviewText: Very friendly service, extremely helpful. Gorgeous room with view of the bay. Location is unbeatable.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Excellent location, but poor sound insulation of rooms makes it less than peaceful.

review.title: Best Hotel Best Place Great Location
review.reviewText: Really a great experience. I really recomend the 480 to anyone. Can`t wait to be back to San FCO and the 480.

review.title: Great overall!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, great location, real good service, and all for a moderate rate, excellent!

review.title: Great Hotel, but...
review.reviewText: Overall, I was pleased with the Hotel 480. Just off Union Square, it is centrally located and near to everything. The problem I had was, at 4:30 in the morning, loud noise from delivery trucks and trash collection boomed into the room! I realize the hotel has no control over external noise sources, but there must be soundproofing that could have been applied, or perhaps they could have given some warning and offered me a room away from the street at check-in.

review.title: Sauna room
review.reviewText: Hotel was undergoing contruction and our room was so hot it was 88 degrees and very noisy. We stayed 1 night and then got upgraded. The conference room was FREEZING!. Not recommended although location was great across from Union Square

review.title: Great location, service, staff.... only complaint was the daily search for ice machines that worked
review.reviewText: Great location, staff, rooms, and service. The construction wasn't a problem at all. The only problem during our 6 days was the constant search for an ice machine that was operating. The lady, name unknown who worked days at front desk was the best! Would stay there again if in area for sure.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: We took advantage of a reasonable room rate for a quick visit to this beautiful city in late October, no doubt offered as a result of the renovation taking place. We were not disappointed. On the plus side, the location is as good as it gets, check-in and check-out were quick and efficient, the room was huge and the view across the city skyline was magnificent. On the minus side, the hotel lacked soul, no doubt caused by the work in progress, and the decor of the room was a little tired.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location - very nice rooms - dissapointed in the Front Desk Staff - upon departure. When asked for FD Manager was told he was busy to come back in 30min - FD staff did not seem interested in assisting guests. I had to return from airport and stayed at the JW Marriott - which was awesome - very different experience, much better trained staff. the JW was twice as much - but it was worth it.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Even thought the hotel is under construction for a needed remodel, we had a very pleasant stay. The noise was not a factor and the room was very comfortable.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in a great location! I was able to walk around everywhere, to get to BART and MUNI, and there was awesome shopping right around the corner. Even though the hotel is under construction, the noise wasn't an issue. My room was on the 8th floor.

review.title: undergoing renovation
review.reviewText: Despite the renovation activities at the present time the rooms are quiet, spacious and clean. We were pleased with the service and the location is great.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and nicely located in the Union Square district. Would stay there again without any question.

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: The hotel is being remodeled, so expect scaffolding outside and some dust. My room was brand new with clean, modern furnishings. (I tried to enter the 24 hr. workout room at 5am only to be told that the door won't open until 6am, so they sent someone to open it.) Other than that, it was excellent.

review.title: Good Find
review.reviewText: They were in the middle of a renovation when we stayed here, so the outside wasn't pretty at all, but the hotel room totally made up for it. The room was a good size, had a great view and was very modern and clean. It was a little pricey, but for Union Square, you really won't find many other places for less. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Would recommend this hotel to others
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 days in October. The hotel was undergoing some renovations at the time - but it was no disruption to our stay or our comfort. We did ask for a room as high up as possible - as the renovations were taking place on the lower floors, but i am not sure that it would have made a lot of difference. Check in was very easy and the staff were helpful. Location was good, the cable cars run outside the hotel and its easy to get on and off them. The concerige was helpful in helping us to book a trip to Alcatraz. Would have been good if they knew more about the hop-on-hop off tours in the city - they only recommended one - but there are in fact three availble (and we fund them a great way to get an overview of the city - and also as a transport option). Overall a great stay - would recomend to others, and would return if we go to San fran in the near future.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Right behind the Union square, it's convenient and within walking distance to the shopping area. Currently it is under renovation - a bit noise may be heard during the day.

review.title: Major problems while under renovation
review.reviewText: Hotel is currently under renovation with a note in the room that any noise would be between the hours of 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. Monday-Friday. Construction crew repeatedly started noisy work in the early morning. Learned that there had been complaints from many guests and was moved to another room that had problems with basic facilities (like the plumbing) that were not resolved during my stay. The location of this hotel is great and I'm sure it will be nice once the renovations are done, but in the meantime it does not live up to its rating since basic services and amenities appear to be unavailable.

review.title: Would not recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: I would not stay at this hotel again due to poor customer service. The air conditioning in our room did not work properly and the hotel management was not happy about moving us to another room, as we requested.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was undergoing some renovation, but with exception to that, it was a very nice place. The room was fantastic. Just beware of the $45/night hotel parking that they don't tell you about when you book rooms in the city through Expedia.

review.title: San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was under renovation of certain floors below our room. There was considerable noise at times. We also had to evacuate at 6:45 am due to a fire alarm...we walked down 21 flights to find a construction worker "cut a wrong wire" on the 18th floor, initiating the fire alarm. THe room was nice and the hotel will be nice once the renovation is complete. I may have opted for a different hotel had I known. But all things considered, it is was okay.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: We were pleased with our stay. Only problem we booked a king & none were available so we had to take 2 doubles.But hotel was nice & clean.The evening door man Fernando was extremely helpful and the most friendly person in SF.Would of liked to have had a fridge in the room.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Centrally located to Union Square with many local cafe's and restaurants nearby, this is a great place to stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The Hotel is undergoing renovations at the moment so there may be some noise during the day. Good value for money.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Having never been to San Francisco, we were looking to stay somewhere near the center of the city. We were thrilled to see that our hotel was right in the thick of things - even near the cable car stop! The only thing we missed was having a small fridge in the room. The hotel staff was very helpful and everything was very clean. Absolutely, a good value. We look forward to coming back someday.

review.title: Excelente hotel, excelente location
review.reviewText: We read some reviews about this hotel in the internet and decided to take a chance and book it. We were extremely pleased to see that the reviews were all true: the rooms were very clean and comfortable and the location was excellent (2 minutes from Union Square). The hotel was going through exterior renovations and interior would follow next, which is surprising since we found the hotel in pretty good shape. These renovations had no impact on our stay, except for the construction work outside, we didn't notice anything.

review.title: Even with current remodeling it's still a great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square. Great restaurant and room service!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Hotel excellent. Would recommend it to others. The maintenance currently in operation during my stay did not affect me. Staff very helpful and friendly. Room was always cleaned immaculately each day by housekeeping. Very centrally located.

review.title: Perfect position for a SF Vacation
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the 480 for 7 days, and it could not have been better. Although the much published renovations clothe the whole of the ground and 1st floor in scaffold and cladding, it had no affect on the internal workings, and no dust or dirt were obvious. A little noise was heard , but nothing to bother you, and only in the 9 - 5 time bracket. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpfull, and we were allocated a room on the 28th floor with good views of the city. The room was large and spotless and the maid service top rate. Few people seem to eat or drink in the hotel, as there are so many other places nearby with more atmospere, I should think that will change when the renovations are complete and you can see in/out from the communal areas. It would also seem that while the renovations are continuing (probably until april 09) there are some pretty good reduction to be had against the rack rates, so I would recommend a check on the 480 if you need a good a bed in the Union Square area

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Location was perfect. Hotel was ideal. Staff were very helpful. Outside work in progress but no inconvenience at all. Altogether a perfect place to stay

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We were travelling with a family, including a baby and this was a perfect hotel for us. The rooms were bigger than expected and the location was just perfect, could not ask for more. They are doing up the hotel so it was a shame the exterior was being worked on, but it did not impact our stay at all. Parking is expensive, but what can you expect staying in a major city. We recommed this hotel

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The Hotel is udergoing refurbishment inside and construction work is being done at the front of the hotel outside.Restaurant not up and running till Feb.2009 and bar snacks only available at present.Would ony recomend this hotel for commercial use at the moment and is not suitable for international guests.

review.title: Great location at a Great Price!
review.reviewText: We spent three nights (a full weekend) at the Hotel 480. I've traveled to SF many times and this was by far the most ideal location -- centrally located close to Union Square, Market Street, Powell, the Cable Cars, BART (which goes directly to SFO), great shopping, etc. The beds were comfy, to boot! And the view! The ONLY criticism would be the construction...but this was completely understandable given the face lift the hotel is receiving which will only make it better!

review.title: Location and Value
review.reviewText: Great location and a good value. Service was excellent. Hotel is currently under renovation- but this did not affect our stay.

review.title: Great location and service
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a perfect location -- easy walking to Union Square, restaurants and other destinations. Very reasonable rates, probably because the exterior of the building is under renovation. The room itself was fine, with very comfortable beds. All staff were courteous and efficient, especially the terrific parking valets.

review.title: Expense Parking
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, but seemed a little old. The gym was adequate but is only good for cardio, if you seriously workout. The biggest rip off at this hotel was the parking. Also, they need to provide free internet, which will be one of my first priorities when choosing my next hotel.

review.title: Comfy hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel! The room was beautiful and completely comfortable. The bed was cushy and a delight to get into each night. The bathroom was always cleaned spic and span and had an awesome toilet. The location was perfect. It is close to most sights and very close to the cable cars and MUNI/BART stations. The neighborhood is quiet and safe at night. I would do anything to stay in this hotel again next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Solid Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: I go to SF every 3-4 months and usually stay around Union Square. This is the first time staying at Hotel 480. My room was very clean and comfortable; great bed linens. The workout facility was also very nice with plenty of machines and weights.They are currently undergoing some exterior remodeling, but there are no issues inside. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great location & value
review.reviewText: This is a re-modeled hotel that is in the heart of San Francisco, a block away from Union Square, and yet it has a small, friendly staff and is very service oriented. We enjoyed our stay very much!

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: When we arrived we were told there was no power in our room for the next 2-4 hours. Room service was not available at all that week. Dining facilities were limited. We scheduled a wake up call, and they failed to do it. They did offer a free continental breakfast after we complained to the manager (took 15 minutes!), but because we were not awakened in time, we could not take advantage of it. We arrived not expecting them to be under construction. They were remoldeling their lobby. This was a surprise - we were not told ahead of time. No price breaks or other consolations were offered.

review.title: Under reconstruction
review.reviewText: The restaurants and front of building were under reconstruction, so the atmosphere inside the hotel was rather bleak. Our room was on the 20th floor and was comfortable. However, the pedestal sink in the bathroom didn't afford any space for curling iron or other items. All items had to be placed on shelf above sink and toilet. It was narrow and items fell off. The bed was extremely comfortable and the staff exceptionally pleasant and helpful. If I could get the same price, I would stay there again.

review.title: hotel under construction
review.reviewText: the hotel was under construction when i got there for my 4 day stay, they started working as early as 8:15, leaving no room for me to sleep in late. staff was ok... not very helpful.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel has been recently renovated. the rooms are wonderful, clean, high standard. The location of the hotel is excellent, right in San Francisco downtown, shopping centers, excellent restaurants and cable cars. I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel 480 is in the perfect location! Walking distance to cable cars, Chinatown and all the shops. It's currently undergoing some reno so definitely ask for a room on the higher floors. We got a fantastic room with a view of the bay area. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Do NOT part at the hotel, VERY expensive. Park in the garage at Sutter/Stockton.

review.title: Good location, and a real bargain at the moment
review.reviewText: This hotel is moving from one large chain to another, and in the interim offers some bargain rates. The location is excellent: one block from Union Square, and on a cable car route. Splendid views from the north-facing rooms. Some lounges are closed and there's some daytime building work, but that didn't spoil our stay at all.

review.title: Thank you Franscis
review.reviewText: My husband and I were traveling with our new 2 month old son. We arrived at the hotel early and wanted to check in early. I am breastfeeding and wanted to feed the baby in the conforts of our room. At first, my husband was talking to the front desk staff and was told our room wasn't ready. After a few minutes, Franscis, the front desk staff, was able to upgrade our room to a junior suite. Our room was so nice and very spacious. We appreciated the upgrade

review.title: DEFINITELY STAY HERE.......
review.reviewText: A bit off-putting: theattitude on the part of some hotel staff was a bit stuffy. And they are in midst of renovations (we were out sight-seeing most of the time, so was not a problem.) HOWEVER, FANTASTIC LOCATION, and they did upgrade us to a room with a view (worth asking for!) Overall, very comfortable rooms... Would stay here again.

review.title: Great room and location for the price
review.reviewText: Not great public spaces, or ambiance, but a terrific location and room (Junior Suite), especially for a family, at a very reasonable price. The room was very large, well furnished, clean, and comfortable with great views.

review.title: Hotel 480
review.reviewText: The Hotel 480 is currently under renovations, so there was construction going on while I was staying at the hotel. The staff was courteous and helpful. The location of the hotel is great! On the downside, the ice machines and vending machines did not work on several of the floors.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: While there was construction going on outside the hotel, inside the hotel was impecably clean. Would recommend staying here again. Central location to Union Square.

review.title: A group of kids
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel with a few of my friends during our Spring Break to San Francisco. The lady at the counter was so nice and funny. She made the check in process so easy, unlike we did. First we got there and the room was too small, so we went to her to ask for another room. The next room wasn't high enough. So she upgraded us to a suite on the last few floors of the hotel. AWESOME SERVICE! All the rooms were clean and well decorated. Felt like my own apartment. No bugs or funny smells. Location is the BEST; diner across the street awesome for a visit after clubbing. Did i mention shopping is only a block away, as is Union Square. WILL STAY HERE AGAIN!

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Newly refurbished high rise hotel with great views from the upper floors. Still some building work going on. Rooms nicely redone, clean and spacious. The only down side was the lack on WiFi internet in the rooms.

review.title: Wonderful Experience!
review.reviewText: This was our first time traveling with our 8 week old baby. When we arrived early to check in our standard room was not ready. My wife needed to change & feed the baby & we were tired from our flight. The front desk clerk was extremely gracious and upgraded us to a junior suite which we were escorted to immediately. The room was amazing with great views of the bay and city lights. The entire stay was a memorable experience. Thanks!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location was great for our shopping trip ve3ry close to all the great stores at Union Square. We also enjoyed th walk to China town as well. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and extremely helpful.

review.title: Can be recommended
review.reviewText: Good location, friendly staff, fair price

review.title: Great location but hardest beds in the world
review.reviewText: Stayed 4 nights in May. Had been under new ownership for a couple of months and it showed. Staff were disgruntled and not very helpful. Conceirge on duty one day only. Towels left on the floor by the bed, one day the room was not made up at all. Beds were like sleeping on the floor they were that hard. Great location but there are better hotels close by.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and comfortable and the staff was polite and cooperative. We had a late flight out and they locked and stored our luggage, after we checked out, for most of the day. Our only disappointment was that internet access was not complimentary.

review.title: Good standard of rooms and location for the price
review.reviewText: It's a fairly typical 4 star hotel as far as the rooms go, but the other areas aren't up to much and are being updated. However, there are plenty of more interesting places to go to eat and drink so this was not a problem for us.

review.title: Hotel 480 is recommended by our family of 4
review.reviewText: This hotel is about the location, but is also great for service. Housekeeping did a great job. A fridge/micro would add to the comfort of the room. Size was fine. We found the Starbucks, Walgreens, and Lorri's Diner across the street to be very convenient. We would have loved to have a small spa/hot tub. We had strenuous walks daily and tired, sore muscles. The double beds were as comfortable as possible but too small. Renovation seems behind schedule. The exercise room was not done as of last week but constr.noise was only heard during daytime hours.Another review said that drinks wouldn't be available from the vending and that was still the case, thus Walgreens comes in handy. The cable cars out in front were convenient as well but trying to come back from the wharf was always a problem with waits up to over an hour in the later day. The F line in front of Old Navy seemed to be the quickest way to get back and forth from the water area. Muir Woods and Sausalito are worth renting a car for one day. Union Sq. has many rental car agencies but many were booked solid. This is cheaper for a family than paying for 4 tour tickets and you can stay as long as you like. That was a 3 hr. tour for most. A rental car would not be convenient for the whole stay, with lack of parking and expense. We did not find the taxi pickup out front of hotel to be overly expensive to travel quickly to the airport for an early flight. It was about a 20 min. drive at 6:30 a.m.

review.title: Noisy, currently under construction - but still worth it
review.reviewText: Hotel 480 is currently under heavy construction, which was not made known to us when we booked. It was extremely noisy and chaotic during the daytime, but that's also a byproduct of the area - Powell Street is a big tourist thoroughfare and the cable cars run up and down it. Rooms toward the top make the noise manageable. In spite of the noise, we did have a pleasant stay. The rooms are large and comfortable for the most part, although I found the bed too firm for my taste. The hotel is well located with easy access to all kinds of public transportation to get you anywhere in the city. All in all, a good value.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: good location just off union square - its on the main street - easy access to china town and most busses etc, contemprary design within the rooms...enjoyed our stay - albeit there are limited facilities in the hotel, but that was not an issue for us as we were more interested being outdoors friends of ours were living a block away from 480 at the another Hotel, which while was a block away is uphill and a not so great place (but that was a budget place so not a fair comp either).

review.title: Nice room with good view. Construction on lower levels though.
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel at a decent rate. The location was good--right on Powell by the cable car lines--easy walk to the end of the line and easy walk to Chinatown. They only have wireless internet in the lobby --rooms have wired internet that they charge you a lot for. Lower floors were under construction, but we didn't hear too much noise.

review.title: If I 'll go again to San Francisco, I 'll go to the same hotel
Great location and view
review.reviewText: Room was very comfortable, location and view were fantastic. Right on the cable car line, walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square.

review.title: very nice, convenient location; personnel were most helpful
review.reviewText: wireless internet worked well; beds very comfy

review.title: clean with good location
review.reviewText: the hotel have a nice and good loaction,

review.title: Good hotel - great position.
review.reviewText: Very pleased overall with the comfort and cleanliness of the hotel and the helpfulness and friendly staff. Disappointed with not knowing beforehand about the maintenance work being carried out during our stay, resulting in a very noisy breakfast, although couldn't hear any disturbance in our 24th storey room. Location ideal for union square, shopping and Chinatown. Cable cars stop opposite front entrance - very convenient for trip to Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Check when renovation complete
review.reviewText: Great position on the junction of Powell and Sutter Streets just a couple of blocks from Union Square and all the downtown shopping. Currently under extensive renovation wouldn't recommend staying until this is finished. Our bathroom shower curtain had mould but was quickly replaced. Stayed in a junior suite which is one large room with King size bed and a sofa bed.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in the heart of everything. Shopping, food and drinks were all around us. While I was there though, my eyes were really irritated...maybe becuase of the construction. I purchased a view room and it was great. I paid for a great view and I had it...I was a little worried I was going to get put in some normal room. The room was a little cold at times and I found the pillows to be uncomfortable. But overall...a good place to stay if you don't want to pay an arm and a leg.

review.title: San Francisco best choice both Leisire (including Kids) or Business.
review.reviewText: Very good location. Your are just a one block of Union Square. Walking distance for good shopping and restaurants. Very safe area for families.

review.title: Good Hotel, Busy Location
review.reviewText: I was pretty happy with the hotel. I didn't like the idea that you had to pay for internet. I feel that if you stay at a hotel, you should get free internet. I also feel that if you are staying at a hotel, you shouldn't pay $48 a day to park, it should be free. The guy who brought our bags in wasn't very friendly, but everything else about the hotel was nice.

review.title: Great place to stay in a perfect location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was under renovation when we were there and the fitness center was closed. They had no other alternative except to pay 5 dollars a day for the fitness center across the way. That was the bummer. On the good side, we got a great deal and it was in the best part of town. We walked around and I wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else!

review.title: Great location and comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: If you want a hotel right at Union Square, and very close to Chinatown, and right on a cable car line, this is the place. The rooms are nice, clean, and comfortable (though not luxury quality, although I hear there is some remodeling being done). Their restaurant is small and slow because it's being remodeled, but room service is fast and very good. Valet parking is right next door.

review.title: The 480 has great amenities and a wonderful location
review.reviewText: We

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: I was very happy with this hotel. It was clean, comfortable, and located in a good location. The only suggestion that I would make to other travelers is not to park in the hotel parking garage. It is very expensive and there are other close-by parking garages that are cheaper.

review.title: just one block from Union Aq.
review.reviewText: Location and room was excellent. The Room was big enought that 2 of us was able ro open our laggage no problem, clean sheets on bed. Nice view from room if you stay 20th floor or higher.

review.title: Quality Hotel at a Great Price
review.reviewText: Our family of 4 stayed for 3 nights and were very pleased with the hotel. We had a room on the 29th floor which had a beautiful view of the city. The room was a great size - 2 teenage boys didn't complain at all! The hotel was going under a bit of maintenance but it was no bother to us. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: This was the perfect place for a few days in San Francisco. Not only was it centrally located, in the heart of Union Square, but the staff was very attentive, from the accompaniments of the room to the service of the lobby staff. Highly recommended to all!

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff were very helpful, rooms were clean, but whilst we were there, from the 3rd day of our stay they started refurbishment work from 9am so no lie ins. Other than that, I was glad I chose this hotel. The location is great, its a very convenient area right in the middle of everything.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The cable car is outside the hotel. Within walking distance to shopping, dining and theater. It has good views from the rooms. Parking is $46.00/ day.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Although we requested a double room because we were travelling with 2 teenagers, when we went to check in they had us in a king bed room. The hotel staff ended up accommodating us with a king suite with a fold out bed and view that we had upgraded to on the Expedia website. I would suggest that this be corrected on the website at booking, so this doesn't happen to others.

review.title: Vacation stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was conviently located in Union Square. Transporataion to and from the hotel by various methods was also convenient. The hotel and the room were clean and seemed to be well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was going through some remodeling, so the on-site restaurant and the fitness center were not available at the time.

review.title: location
review.reviewText: Great place, good amentities, there are flashier and more expensive but this was a great buy. two blocks from china town and Union square, easy trip to the wharf and the italian district where there is great food. I would/will stay there next time we go to San Francisco

review.title: Price was right
review.reviewText: Close to everything in Union Square area. Gym is under renovation, but hotel provides passes to nearby fitness center. Front desk staff was indifferent, but the rate was almost half that of nearby hotels.... overall a good stay.

review.title: Treated like royalty
review.reviewText: I extremely impressed with how helpful everyone was. For a great price we were treated like royalty. The children were in very impressed. They never had anyone wait on them before.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel with a great staff. You can't beat the location. The vending machines on floors 18-25 were either broken or sold out of water. I gave up after checking 7 floors and just went to Walgreens across the street for any of our snacking needs. That would be the only drawback. There was some construction taking place around the restaurant and gift shop area but it didn't affect us. I would definately stay there again!

review.title: absolutely no charm
review.reviewText: unfriendly hotel desk staff. rooms and interior hallways resembled a hospital. work out room not available and had to pay for the alternative down the street. internet connection very pricey. I do not recommend at all.

review.title: Good Family pick
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the process of updating, so everything was new and clean and comfortable beds, a must for us. Helpful staff and friendly. Only caution is to ask for a floor not near construction if you are a late sleeper. It didn't bother us, but we heard hammering etc. from our sixth floor room starting about 7:30 AM. From the hotel to public trans is a short, safe walk, with kids. Breakfast across the corner and other eating choices nearby. Didn't try the hotel food, so can't comment on that.

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable and a great value. The location was perfect for us: clsoe to the calbe car line and within walking distance of excellent shopping and restaurants. The next time we are in San Francisco, we'll go back.

review.title: Vacation Family Trip
review.reviewText: Was clean, near shooping, dining,entertaiment, attractions, everything is walking distance. The service was o.k. We did not have any complaint. We would stay here again.

review.title: Real nice!
review.reviewText: Great location to dining and shopping. Fun to hop on the cable car across the street!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in Union Square and the trolley stop is right outside the hotel. It's within easy walking distance to shopping and bus lines. Staff was polite and helpful. I would definitley stay there again!

review.title: Great find!
review.reviewText: The location is great...it is right across WalGreens, the trolley is right outside; Macy and Chinatown is about 2 blocks down. It is a safe location, great for family. The room is pretty spacious. My family and I were very satisfied!

review.title: Great hotel with excellent service
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel were very accomodating, even when I added two people to my reservation and asked to change my room type. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Being up on the 22nd floor blocked out most street sounds. The location was perfect for shopping and sightseeing. I will definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

review.title: nice hotel with great location for a reaonable price
review.reviewText: We left this hotel with no complaints other than the cost of internet access when we had expected the lobby wireless to be free. The bell staff were very cordial and the consierge and desk staff were efficient. Right after our stay at Hotel 480 we moved on to a four star hotel paid for by my work that cost over a hundred more a night. The differences were mainly apparant in the lobby glitz but the rooms were virtually identical.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the choice I made to stay at this hotel. Excellent service, clean room and I even had a nice view. If you are looking to hang out anywhere around Union Square, this is the hotel for you. It is just a few blocks from the Bart station, not far to walk. Everything is within walking distance, trolleys, shopping galore, food... Thanks Hotel 480!

review.title: Good Hotel to stay at!!
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel as the rooms were kept in superb condition. Toilets were very clean. Overall, the whole hotel experience was very good and comfortable. Love the location as its situated in Union Square itself.. Ideal for shopaholics! Subway station was nearby too!

review.title: Will definitely use again
review.reviewText: The room we got was better than I expected. It was clean. It was also quite roomy. We got the 2 beds option which came with 2 double size beds. It would be better if they were queen size. The bathroom was equipped to help elderly or handicap persons, it had hand rails next to the toilet and a fold down seat in the shower stall. We did have a leak in the shower hose, they replaced it right away with a new one. The only down side to this hotel is they charge about $50 (tax included) a day for parking. You could save $15 by parking at 450 Sutter St or more at the underground parking under Union Square (approx 2 short blocks away). Overall, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would recommend it.

review.title: Convenience and good price
review.reviewText: It was very convenience to shop, to get a cable car, and to eat. Good location and nice people.

review.title: Great location in SF
review.reviewText: Great location within the city. Room service is pricy, so utilize the downstairs restaurant and cafe.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location, very close to union square, trolley, fisherman's warf... excellent service... not too expensive.

review.title: Great Location, Great Service - Good Choice for Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel 480 for 2 nights recently. We were a party of 6 and had several rooms. Each of the rooms were clean and in good condition. All of the staff were extremely friendly, professional and helpful: from the staff at the front door welcoming us into the hotel, to the Front Desk staff checking us in to the housekeeping staff. The Concierge was extremely helpful and professional. The location is excellent, in the Union Square area, at the intersection of Sutter and Powell at 480 Sutter St. Everything is so convenient - just out the door to the Cable Car and one block to some of the best shopping in San Francisco. We had a wonderful experience at the Hotel 480 and would recommend it to anyone. p.s. We heard that it may be turning into a Marriott in the next few months so I do not know if that means it will change names

review.title: Great hotel at a competitive price.
review.reviewText: My family booked this hotel after extensively researching the options, and we made a good choice. The staff is eager to be helpful, and the concierge was knowledgeable and saved us a lot of time in considering options. The room was in very good condition and clean (very important!). And the hotel is only one block from Union Square, three blocks from Chinatown, and you can access public transit very easily to get just about anywhere, including the cable cars.

review.title: Great Value for an upscale San Fransisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Upon arrival the staff was friendly. Check in went well. I had requested two rooms adjoining but that request could not be fulfilled. The rooms we received were on opposite ends of the same floor. Rooms were clean and comfortable. (The air conditioning was not running well and was very noisy. Luckily it was not needed too much). If you are looking for a hotel close to the usual tourist spots such as Fisherman's Wharf, this is not it but all are within reach via mass transit. A city wide transit pass is $11 a day or $18 for three days. That adds up when you are traveling with a family of seven. Look out if you have a vehicle, parking is $45 a day at the hotel. I did not see anywhere close to park for less than $35. Hotel valet service only, requires a little planning, they want 20 minutes notice to have your cat delivered to the front door or be ready for pick up at the garage entrance.

review.title: Absolutely loved it!!!!
review.reviewText: From the curb side valet service to the check out this was by far the best Hotel experience that we have had in a long time. Everything was 1st class. The breakfast buffet was varied enough to please all ages and tastes.

review.title: 480 a Perfect 10
review.reviewText: This hotel had a beautiful view and was close to everything we wanted to do

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel, but not three and a half stars. More like three. Why are comprable star ratings in other cities over rated in San Francisco?

review.title: Great location great price
review.reviewText: I booked this for the location and based on other people's reviews and I was not disappointed - the room was well sized, well priced and close to everything we wanted. Will definitely look at staying here again next time I'm in San Fran.

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: We were happy with the Hotel 480. The rooms were a good size, although they didn't have fridges in the rooms which we wanted. The two beds were doubles but comfortable. The service was solid without being outstanding. It's in a great location and for the price we were happy with what we got. Others in our group also stayed there and were happy with the choice.

review.title: great trip
review.reviewText: great location but a bit expensive for parking.

review.title: Will stay here again
review.reviewText: One of the better hotels to stay in for it's price in SF. Parking is very expensive, though. Instead of parking with the hotel, there is a parking garage right next to the hotel. It is at least about $15 dollars cheaper per day, same in and out previlages, just no valet service.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! You can't beat the location,it's right in the heart of union square and right off the cable car line. Staff was friendly and they went out of their way to try to accomodate us. Our room was clean, comfortable and had beautiful views of the city. The only negative comment I have is that the walls were super thin and I could hear everything that was going on above us and next door to us. Luckily we didn't have any super noisy neighbors. I would stay here again!

review.title: Very good value, great location, definitely will stay again.
review.reviewText: Very difficult for us to find as we drove in and are not familiar with the streets. Parking was $46.00 overnight. The stay was pleasant, the view fantastic, the bed and pillows very cozy and comfortable.

review.title: Very happy customer
review.reviewText: The location, the price and the friendly staff. It was just perfect. The front desk and the bell man were very kind and helping with some car troubles we had. This is a prime location, everything is so nearby. Will definetly return if in the area again.

review.title: Excellent for the Value
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in the heart of town, near Union Square and on the cable car line. The staff at the hotel was extremely courteous, friendly and very helpful with suggestions on restaurants, shopping, etc. Rooms were clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again on future trips to San Francisco.

review.title: Very nice.......
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location, walk out the door turn right and you're on the cable car line. YOU MUST buy the all day pass or 1,2,or 3 day pass for the public trans. big money saver. I will tell my friends to stay at 480. be sure to ask for the high floor towards the water. I stayed on 23 and was very nice

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Service was good. Excellent location next to Union Square/the cable car line. For its price, it was a decent hotel to stay at.

review.title: Great bargain!
review.reviewText: Got a very cheap rate on Expedia for this hotel, and got upgraded for free to a junior suite--not bad! It used to be the Crowne Plaza; great location in the heart of Union Square. The decor and furnishings are pretty dated. Fitness center was still under renovation (although they had told me on the phone that it was open--poor form!). Parking will cost you beaucoup bucks, but it's a block away from the Sutter/Stockton garage, which will probably be cheaper, depending on how long you leave the car.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and more than I expected....

review.title: good value for the money
review.reviewText: overall very good for the price, within a few minutes from the convention center - not luxurious but clean & comfortable

review.title: Nice and Sweet Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is suitable for family. I definitely recommend it to you. The location is great and close to Union Square in downtown SF.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel can't be beat. The are in the process of updating the hotel. Even though I had one of the rooms that had not been updated it was perfectly fine. Great service from the staff.

review.title: Inexpensive and blah
review.reviewText: This hotel is good for anyone wanting a cheap stay with a spotless room. However, I had the pleasure of staying at The Fairmont up the street before heading down to this hotel, and it was a big downer. My A/C didn't work on the day it got into the mid 90s in the city. Fortunately, the cool foggy breezes came through the following day, so this was a temporary inconvenience. Then my TV broke. I will say though when I called, they had a very nice repair guy up within 10 minutes, and the TV replaced within that hour. So that was good. Good, cheap, central locale.

review.title: right on the cable car line
review.reviewText: comfortable. restaurant rather expensive though

review.title: A bit tired, but fine
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location 1 block from Union Square. The staff is pleasant and things are clean if a bit tired looking. I got a great price on a corner suite on the second floor from the top (29?). Nice view of Coit tower and bay beyond.

review.title: Great location/very comfortable!
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel was very accommodating, the place beautiful & the location perfect! Right across the street from a Starbuck's and a Walgreen's as well as one of the stops for the trolley! Would definitely do it again!

review.title: Pratical, nice hotel.
