review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't all frills and fancy, but it was clean, practical, had a nice restaurant and bar. It was classy San Francisco style, of course. The staff receptionist, valet, and assistants were all very helpful/nice which offered a refreshing break from the usual snobby staff of other hotels that I've stayed at (ie Serrano). The first half of the floors were under renovation fyi (June 08). If you have money to burn then you can always choose one of the more spendy hotels but I'd recommend this hotel as being good and classy for the price.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the heart of Union Square. This means you are in walking distance to shopping and many key 'art' destinations. Public transportation is also in walking distance, such as the BART.

review.title: Nice place close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice. We were upgraded to a family room with a pull out sofa and great view of the city. The staff was very helpful. The concierge was able to get us tickets to Alcatraz for the day after we arrived. The bellman had a great tip on where to get the best dim sum. A very enjoyable stay. Convenient to shopping, chinatown and great restaurants. Would definitely recommend!

review.title: Lovely hotel and all the staff were very helpful!
review.reviewText: The rooms were very clean and the very tastefully decorated. Location was great!

review.title: Friendly staff, quiet rooms, great location.
review.reviewText: Only issue was the air conditioning. It was not great!

review.title: Perfect if you don't want to break the bank
review.reviewText: The hotel is right in the heart of San Francisco, close to everything that's important. Union Square is just around the corner. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable, but it doesn't try to impress with extravagance. The staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, I thought it was a great hotel for the relatively inexpensive price.

review.title: Nice place to stay in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Hotel is really well located. Room was very comfortable and clean. Expect everything you see in their webpage. I do recommend this hotel.

review.title: Definitely Recommend
review.reviewText: My husband and I had one day to spend in San Francisco before meeting up with friends. We found the staff to be helpful and professional. They stored our bags for us for several hours while we toured around after checking out. The room was a bit small but very comfortable and clean. The location is extremely convenient. It is about 5 blocks from a BART station, 2 blocks from Union Square, 3 blocks from Chinatown and there is a cable car stop directly by the hotel. The small restaurant offers a nice breakfast but as you would expect in a hotel it was a bit pricey. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and would stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel to stay in.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and customer service was great. Parking was expensive but other than that hotel was great. Great location.

review.title: needs improvement
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful, but the rooms were below satification.The walls and carpet in the hallways looked dirty and rundown. It looked like a cheat motel 6 hotel. Paint was chipped on the ceiling and the bath towels were dingy looking and feeling. The room smelled so we had to purchase air and surface sanitizer to feel comfortable. We realize you are renovating the hotel but guests are still paying for a 3 star hotel.

review.title: solid hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff extremely friendly, especially the house keeping staff who always smiled and greeted you genuinely! The walgreens in front of the hotel was a huge plus to get items quickly.

review.title: Great deal while they are remodeling
review.reviewText: The room rate was a steal for this area because the hotel is currently remodeling. The only indication that my husband and I saw of the remodel were cables hanging outside of our window, but we never saw any workers. There was a note in the room that they were doing work on the outside of the building from 9am-5pm and that they needed about 30 mins in front of each window. The gym was closed also, but with all of the walking we did during the day, we did not miss the gym. The room that we stayed in was small, but clean and had a great view of the city and ocean. We were able to walk or take the cable cars everywhere we wanted to go in the city. We went to Pier 39 a couple of times during our visit, but I'm glad that we did not stay in that area - way too touristy with the T-shirt shops and street performers. The sea lions are the best attraction at Pier 39 and are a must-see for any animal lover (we went back the second time just to see them again). We booked our alcatrez tickets ahead of time from the official website & saved money and time by doing so, however you have to take a chance on the weather cooperating with you. We also booked a one day tour of wine country. I would recommend both tours to any couples.

review.title: Good hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: My friends and I stayed in this hotel for a bachelorette party. This hotel could not be more perfect. It was in walking distance to the heart of Union Square, China Town, the Bart and the Muni. It was clean and quiet. I would stay there again.

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, quite, and the service was great

review.title: I would suggest this hotel to everyone!!!!
review.reviewText: There is not one negative thing I can say about Hotel 480. There was no issues with my reservation, the staff was very nice, the hotel was clean. It was perfect really! It is also in a PERFECT location for San Francisco. Right in Union Square which is the heart of the shopping area (Think 5th Ave in New York City). And you're 5 min from all tourist attractions...Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, China Town etc. All in all...it was wonderful!

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: Even though the hotel has been sold and is no longer Crowne Plaza, the service was more than adequate and the staff was generally very helpful and friendly. My wife and I have stayed there for four years in a row and have been more than satisfied with the accomodations. Its central location near Union Square and its location on the cable car line area make it very attaractive and convenient.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: We had such a good time. Our room had a beautiful view of the bay. When we arrived, the sun was shining and there were tons of sailboats. It was stunning. We were completely surrounded by fog when we woke. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We were able to check in early. I would definitely stay at Hotel 480 again.

review.title: Great location, ok room
review.reviewText: This was the perfect location for our show at the Warfield, only 6 blocks away. The lobby is lovely, the staff were helpful, and the room was clean. Nothing spectacular- very outdated with no opening window, but clean. Hotel parking was EXPENSIVE for the 24 hours- I would find your own. Bottom line- if the room hadn't been on sale I would have been unsatisfied with the overall hotel quality, but it was so it was fine.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is at a great location near Union Square, Chinatown, shopping and the cable cars. The room was a good size with views of Union Square and the bay, however friends had a much smaller room for the same price. Beds were very comfortable. Food in the cafe downstairs had been kept hot for too long and was overpriced. A very pleasant stay.

review.title: Fabulous Time
review.reviewText: This hotel was great and it is in a great location. Parking is a little pricey but I at least knew my car was safe. The staff was more than helpful and our room was clean. We had one little maintenance problem but they are more the willing to assist us. I would definitely go back and stay.

review.title: Great deal - get it while you can
review.reviewText: Just stayed in a large, two double-bed room - just one block from Union Square - for a very reasonable rate. Decor may be a little tired, but the room was clean and comfortable. Rumour has it (overheard in the lift) that this hotel is on gardening leave before becoming part of a major chain - prices will surely rise. At the moment, a great deal for tourists. Not so good for business travellers as business centre services & internet access were limited yet still expensive.

review.title: Great hotel, can't wait to go again
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel because my husband had a conference there. We've stayed in SF many times and this was the nicest hotel we've stayed at, in the best location, just one block from Union Square. We were on the 23rd floor so we had no problems with street noise, but just walk right outside the front doors and you are in the thick of things. I would highly recommend this hotel. The great price was an added bonus!

review.title: Excellent location and service
review.reviewText: Excellent overall

review.title: Terrific Staff...for the most part
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was terrific! Concierge, cleaning service and front desk folks that is. The car/bellmen, not so much. Bad attitudes there and then expected a tip on top of it. I was in a decent-sized room, clean and comfortable! Did not have hotel "guide" or instructions (internet, phones, policies, etc). Very central to all places...just don't know why none of the locals heard of the place. Everytime I answered the "where are you staying question" with Hotel 480, I received a very blank stare. Hidden gem?

review.title: Great Hotel For The Price
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean, comfortable, and close to Union Square. We parked in the parking garage next door because it was cheaper than using the hotel garage. Decor was a bit dated, but the hotel was clean, the employees were helpful, and the hotel was quiet. I have a hard time sleeping in hotels and we were high above the noise of the streets. We never even heard the people in the rooms around us. Overall, a great stay and I would stay there again.

review.title: 480 Rocks!!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the 480 April 18th and 19th. We had three rooms in our group. They weren't able to give us connecting rooms, but we were all placed on the same floor. (If you do get connecting rooms, they aren't connected inside the room, but an outer door sections off your front doors. This seemed like a particularly nice way to do it.) The staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Exceptional service. Rooms were very comfortable, except the bathrooms could use more counter space and a mini-bar would be nice. But, you simply cannot beat the location!! We walked to just about everything and when we couldn't walk we just grabbed the nearby trolley or BART. During our stay we saw a couple famous rockers that were also staying there. So, you KNOW it must be nice. You Rock 480!!!

review.title: Spacious, Clean, Comfortable
review.reviewText: This hotel was just perfect for our purposes - very comfortable, clean, and the staff was super friendly and helpful. The location is great too, right in the middle of everything, close to subway, trolley right outside. There are a couple great cafes nearby that were terrific for breakfast -- Roxanne's and Cafe de la Presse. (They serve more than breakfast but that's all we had there) San Francisco is a beautiful city - I can't wait to go back!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a very comfortable hotel. We picked this hotel off of a list for a conference my husband was going to and we were very pleased. The beds were incredibly comfortable and we had a beautiful view of the bay. The staff was very friendly and helpful and there is a cable car stop is across the street. Down side was they charged for internet service, both wired in the room and wireless in the lobby. When internet in the room is paid for, it only applies to one computer (we had 2 laptops with us).

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText: The Hilton next to China town might not be close to union sq but its more bang for buck

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: When checking in, the staff was friendly but I couldnt seem to "encourage" any upgrades or niceties. Everything was good but a little stoic, when we disturbed the maid still cleaning the assigned room. A call to the front desk immediately got us an upgraded room (family suite) with plenty of apologies. I suspect my first desk clerk was just a little tired. No regrets, the room was wonderfully large enough to accommodate my teenage daughters explosion of clothes and travel supplies. The hotel is on the cable line with a stop on the corner. Rides to Market Street were almost unnecessary because five blocks downhill was nothing. Coming home or going to the piers was easy with the cable line. My only regret is my room looked directly at The Cheesecake Factory two blocks away on top of Macys. I think I resisted one night out of four, going to sleep without a slice of "sin" ruining my diet. For those needing a workout facility, the hotel's is being remodeled. They give you a "comp" card for 24 hr fitness five blocks away. It wasnt offered at first but seemed to be no problem once I asked. Do eat at "Sears fine foods" across the street and down the block (visible from the front door). Their mini Swedish pancakes are fantastic. French toast was pretty good as well. Overall, I think I enjoyed the best medium budget version of a downtown hotel. You can spend less and get a lot less. I'm not sure you can get much more without really turning out your wallet.

review.title: Never heard of it before - but now I'll recommend it
review.reviewText: Very clean, amazing location, very nice play to stay in Union Square.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: nice hotel, close to union square, china town, directly on cable car route... would reccommend

review.title: Very nice hotel right next to the cable car stop.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel within walking distance of most everything. Would go back and stay here again.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great location just off Union Square next to cable cars. Comfortable room. Great price for the features of the hotel and location. 25th floor still had some street noise, otherwise quiet until 2am when groups came back from the bars but noise didn't last long, just expect that there'll be noisy groups then.

review.title: Amazing hotel experience for the buck and otherwise
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. Book your room before the word catches on and the rates skyrocket. Closeby to the trollys- shopping- restaurants- Staff was nice- Bellmen a bit rude

review.title: Alright
review.reviewText: This hotel is located right on the cable car line. It is walking distance to loads of shopping and restaurants. We previously stayed at a comparably priced, big Union Square hotel which offered much the same impersonal, "here's your room" service. The only major extra that Hotel 480 had was its prime location.

review.title: Very good value for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a short stay in San Francisco. The hotel is located right downtown, within a block of Union Square, a cable car stop, restaurants and bars. The room was clean, well maintained and the staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: I was very satisfied with my stay at Hotel 480. I found the staff to be extremely friendly and efficient, the rooms were clean and comfortable, the location is great, and the price is so much lower than other options in the area. The decor is a little dated, but everything was clean and nice.

review.title: Great location, good value
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel at the end of February 2008. The location is perfect, next to Union square and China Town and the cable car right next door. Rooms are clean and nicely high up (no noise). Good value for money. We did not eat at the hotel. Make sure to park around the corner on Bush Street ($30 / day vs $50/day at the hotel)

review.title: Very conveniently located.
review.reviewText: Close to everything of interest.

review.title: great hotel and location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! located in a great location to experience San Franscisco. In Walking distance of so much. Highly reccomend it. Conceirge was very helpful. Doorman could be alittle more attentive and friendly. This is the first impression you see. Overall a great vacation and experience.

review.title: Id recommend it
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine but nothing special. I was very disappointed when i asked at 4pm to have champagne glasses send to my room and i told them they had till 11pm to do it but when i returned at midnight I found no glasses in the room. There bar closes very earlier, we returned from a concert at 11.30 hoping to have a drink at the bar only to find it closed. The fitness room was nice all the equipment looked pretty new.

review.title: Fantastic!
review.reviewText: Great location, right on the cable car and just a short walk to the Mall, the staff were wonderful.

review.title: Quite decent, excellent location
review.reviewText: This hotel was the former Crowne Plaza. The location is excellent, right on Union Square. The rooms are great, very clean and have all amenities. Parking at the nearby Stockton/Sutter garage is quite cheap too for Union Square. For the price provided on Expedia, you can't go wrong.

review.title: A great stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and comfortable. Ocean view rooms are nice. Staff was very helpful.

review.title: Not awful, not spectacular
review.reviewText: We stayed for 2 nights in Jan 2008. The king sized bed was comfortable and clean, and the room was a nice size for SF. The bathroom , though clean, was outdated and needed modernization. We were on the 19th floor and had no issues with street noise. Very safe, convenient location and great access to the cable cars. It wasn't a ritzy place to stay, but it did the trick!

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great location close to union square and has beautiful views of the city, and bay.

review.title: Don't want to tell...
review.reviewText: Really don't want to tell you how much I enjoyed my stay here because everyone will register here and the hotel may be full next time I plan to return!

review.title: Great Location;Great Staff
review.reviewText: Ive stayed in many hotels and I have never woken up covered in hives. I had an allergic reaction to the linen both nights I was there but the staff was friendly about it, offered to change the linen and even change us rooms. But still, I couldnt escape the linen; so if you have sensitive skin, pack your own linen! The hotel is in an excellent location. It costs us about $8 to get to the wharf by taxi; Macys and all the shopping you can handle is about a block away.
